text: Amazing sushi, I love going here because it's decent price for good sushi.   What I don't like is the servers, they never smile, can't seem to figure out how to take care of there tables. I am a regular here, I go about once a weekend and the servers are still rude. Never expect a drink refill or for them to talk to you after you get your food.

I'm a sushi junkie. I've hit up almost every sushi joint that I've been able to find in Phoenix including the places that identified merely with a yellow sign outside that says..."SUSHI"!   That's why I was so excited to try out Yen. I loved the place the second I walked in. The atmosphere was great, the people were friendly, and the location for me is excellent. Unfortunately for this sushi joint...I really only care about the sushi. That's why one of my favorite places in town is a hole in wall over on Dunlap and 19th Ave. I was so disappointed with the quality of the fish and the actual rolls. We ordered about eight rolls and only finished two of them. You basically have your choice of eel or fried and these are tempura battered rolls I'm talking about. I enjoy light sushi which is the way sushi is supposed to be. A fried tuna roll that weighs over a pound is just too heavy. I'll give it another shot for sure because I really do think it's a nice place but I was shocked that it's Yelp score was as high as it was.

Really enjoyed their Sushi. Went here last weekend and got Sushi to-go. I like the décor of the restaurant, it's dark and is actually updated and looks modern.  I had a California roll, crunch roll, & a Rock N Roll. (I'm no sushi expert, I just like the simple sushi rolls)They were really good no complaints there. Good service from the hostess and didn't take long at all. My only complaint is that the rolls seemed a little overpriced, but I wasn't there during Happy Hour time so maybe they are cheaper then.
This is one of the greatest place to get good quality  sushi and sashimi in town. Strongly recommend this place if you like Japanese food!

Great sushi, very innovative with use of ingredients. Tomato, jalapeño, etc. May not be traditional, however well executed. The Ono Sashimi shows great respect for fish, just garlicky soy sauce, radish. Quite good. Service is good, Paul is a great chef. Sit at counter, enjoy the show.
Amazing sushi at a reasonable price! Clean restaurant with speedy, friendly service. Best rainbow roll my husband and I had ever had. Will definitely be returning to this gem.

This place is traditional with it's japanese heritage looks, yet not with there traditional sushi bar openings. Most sushi bars are NOT open on Sundays, yet this one is! It's amazing. I love it. Especially there happy hour days are to die for! 3-5 & 8-close! 5 dollar expensive sushi rolls! I am a california roll fan, and they have this 'crazy boy roll' with is tempura california roll, MMMMMazing! Only one dislike...they serve soda out of cans. boo=[

Wow. Just Wow.   Took advantage of happy hour tonight and I'm impressed. $5 Philadelphia and Spicy Tuna Tempura rolls. The Spicy Tuna roll is hands down my favorite from anywhere so far.  The Spicy Tataki and Heart Attack rolls had the heat I was wanting, however the heat from the Tataki Roll came out of nowhere and bowled me over with spice.  The wonderful rolls with 2 BIG bottles of Saporo for $3 a pop and out the door for under $50 really made our night.   We'll definitely be back.    My only issue has nothing to do with the restaurant. The domain listed on their take home menu isn't owned by anyone at the moment. Picky I know, but a massive pet peeve of mine. If you are restaurant, have a website and one that is mobile accessible. I was going to knock off half a star for this, but I then realized it's part of a chain in California and they don't have any control over it. So 5 stars it stays.

Staff was super friendly and customer service was great. They have a really good Happy Hour; $5 sushi rolls. We ordered 3 rolls which filled us up. It's a cute little place and although it's kind of hidden, it seems to be getting a lot of attention!

Came and visited for my first time while on my business trip from California. Let me warn YOU! Garbage tasting food, garbage ass sushi.. and I'm being nice right now..... should have known, can't expect authentic sushi in middle of the desert. Shaking my head. Stomach hurting so much now, about to throw up!!

Hands down one of the best sushi bars I have been to...  And I am not just saying this b/c I live on the same street as yen sushi.... however the service is HORRIBLE!  Waitress didnt ever come to check on me in a 45 minute period (after me asking one of the sushi chefs to have them get me more water).  My first roll came out 20 min before my other 2  and on top of that, in the hour i was there,  when i ordered something to go after my meal it wasnt even what i ordered (well not completely).    Here is what happened with what i ordered.  I ordered a spicy octopus roll to go (one of my favorites)  all that was in my to go box was some white rice with some sesame seeds on it!!!   wtf?!?!?!  and i didnt notice this until well after i got home (after they were closed)  b/c it was a snack for later!   so my suggestion is that you ONLY GO THERE WHEN GARY IS WORKING AS THE SUSHI CHEF!  all the other chefs suck balls!    i also saw the other two chefs screw up other peoples orders twice while i was there.  both couples sent their food back!  This is not the first time i have seen cooks, other than Gary, screw up peoples stuff.  I have seen it on a good handful of occations (usually at night).  so go for lunch or before the main crowd.  this all goes to show that even the best place some times hires a shitty Chef... make sure you know your sushi chefs b/c that is the key in having good sushi.   and all other cooks other than gary suck balls at that place.  so be careful and dont go eat there if you dont see Gary behind the sushi line.  i use to give them a full 5 stars but i had to redo my review after a lot of visits there.  However i will for sure still go there when Gary is working ... he really truly is a GREAT sushi chef!
This is my favorite sushi restaurant. The staff is friendly and service is prompt.  I can't wait to come again to have yummy sushi.

The sushi here was good. Wish they had more rolls on the happy hour menu. I really liked how small this place was. The sushi was awesome and the happy hour rolls were reasonably priced.  This is a popular spot so get there early to avoid the lines...

Always fresh. The happy hour is great with a decent selection off apps, rolls, beer, and sake all around $5. I usually get a roll or 2 on HH but then have to always get some ala carte nigiri. The halibut, salmon, and yellowtail belly are all great. Being just down the street for me it's a no brainier.
Best sushi in town, hands down... The baked lobster roll, and heart attack roll are both incredible...
Was greeted with smiles, everyone was cool with the fact I was on a date with myself. The food was good and it was affordable. Smiles all around :-)

Their sushi is amazing BUT the chefs are ridiculously rude for no apparent reason...and I tip them every time I sit @ the counter...I don't even get a I Nishi Wah it's all good--cause they their sushi is

Note: I'd like to give this place 4.5 stars, but since they only allow full star ratings, i'm leaning towards the 5.   This place is right around the corner from my house, has really high quality sushi, a great happy hour, and good prices. It's my new favorite sushi place!  Service: We went during happy hour, so the place was packed. The food came out in an acceptable time considering the number of people. The staff was attentive and told us when the happy hour pricing changed so we would be aware on the bill. Knowing they were on top of it, made me not worry about anything and just relax. Our cups were refilled in a timely manner, and we were offered our choice of seating. So, no complaints on service.   Food: No complaints on the sushi either. The texture and flavors of the fish were exactly what i like in my sushi.  The chili crab roll on the happy hour menu will keep us coming back for a long time. We look forward to trying new rolls each time as well!

My favorite sushi restraunt in AZ. You know a good restraunt when the food  quality is consistent. Great fresh sushi. I usualy order the lunch special yellow tail scallion roll with salmon, tuna,and shrimp sushi. I think it's around $8 dollars. I've been going to this spot for about 3 years and I will continue to go. Wait staff is friendly and the owners are great. Thanks Yen for your amazing food!!!!

This is by far the best sushi place I have ever been to (have never lived near the ocean). Everything was fresh. The king crab and asparagus roll was the best sushi roll I have ever had...the asparagus was cooked to perfection and cooled to the perfect temperature, the king crab melt-in-your mouth goodness, and the plate was dotted with a delicious spicy red chili sauce that complemented it all perfectly! The tuna and scallion roll was fabulous...the tuna was very fresh and clean tasting. Our friends had the baked scallop roll and boy was that decadent! Yum! It was a California roll topped with scallops in a rich cream-based sauce, broiled beautifully. The plain California roll was also excellent. The king crab roll was very good...a pocket of nori stuffed with a wonderful shredded king crab salad. I don't know how any other sushi place in Phoenix is going to compare to this.

Excellent food!  Delightful staff!    We love this place.  You always feel welcomed any time or day of the week. The atmosphere is intimate, and the staff are always smiling and quick with service.  I give the 4 out of 5 stars only due to the fumes of the nail salon next door. I don't know if Yens can do anything to prevent it,  but sometimes it's overbearing.   Great job Yens staff!

What a dump!! The waitress forgot my wife's order, brought the beer with the glass stuck in the top of the bottle. No traditional Japanese greeting when entering and I don't think they cared if I left or not- I hate places that you have to hunt down the waitress to find your order, then hunt the ass again so you can have another beer. Really if you're that lazy-- just stay home like the rest of the people who don't want a job. Never again after living in Japan for 5 years with good sushi every wear these people need some serious training- YUCK!!!

5 stars for the food.  3 stars for the service.  The sushi is among the best in town.  I have never had a bad experience with the food.  The service seems to be getting better.  I stopped going here for a few months due to bad service but the thought of the food drew me back.  I have not found better Ono anywhere in town.  The Forever Young roll combines the Ono with REAL king crab - I dream about eating it.

This place is awesome! They make delicious sushi and are pretty quick at doing it even when it's SUPER busy. Expect to be waiting a bit for reverse happy hour on the weekends. Staff is super friendly and helpful. There's only one girl that seems like she hates her job every time we go in there but for the most part everyone is super great! We've ventured to other sushi places since eating here and they just do not compete!

This restaurant was recommended by a friend who raves about it. the food was good. Nice selection of rolls and the sashmi was very fresh and good. I ordered the peach sohcu to drink...Not sure what it was suppopsed to taste like but it basicially was semi chilled peach schnapps in a martini glass. My only suggestion for the place would be to clean it up just a little. There were  some old dirty napkins under the table to stop it from wiggling and the childrens changing table in the womens bathroom was dirty. But over all great location and good food.

Best in town and i've eaten at a lot of different sushi bars.  This one takes the cake well beyond even some more expensive Scottsdale locations.  Sushi is fresh and tasty.  The arrangements are very nice, not over the top so you still know what you're about to eat.  Happy hour menu contains lots of $5 choices, including large sake bombers!    If you're vegan or veg, this place has lots of options for you.  Get the Veggie Gyoza appetizer, you will not regret it.  Staff is extremely friendly, seating is unique with a long cushioned bench along one side.  Perfect for groups of up to 8-10.  To the regulars: please stop bringing your babies.  I know happy hour is worthy of daily visits, but your kids are crying because they don't want to be there.
Best sushi restaraunt in Phoenix. We go here as often as we can and they never dissapoint.   Happy hour is wonderful.

If you are looking for a nice quiet corner place for the entire family, this is the place, don't let the location fool you.  We love it..good price and great happy hour.  taking the kid tonight...btw.
If you are seriously sashimi lover,go for somewhere else.They served smelly fish and I couldn't believe they put sesame oil on hamachi!

What more can I say that everyone else hasn't said? I found this place through this website so I decided to go with my mom for my birthday for the 8 to close happy hour. We walk in and are immediately greeted by the owner. The waitress was so friendly and helpful. We got the smoked salmon sushi (avocado, smoked salmon, with lemon wedges), Spicy tuna tempura rolls, fresh salmon sashimi, salmon roll ( salmon, crab, avocado, cucumber and deep fried) with $3 large bottle Kirin and $5 watermelon martini. All I can say is WOW!!! Last time had such great sushi was in Maui. The salmon sashimi was like butter in my mouth. This beats the other sushi bars that are in Scottsdale and Tempe. Even with out the happy hour prices it is so very cheap for the quality of sushi. We are going back tomorrow with others so they can experience this amazing jewel in the desert.

I went there with four of my friends. expecting good price and good shuhi. After paying over $130 but feel still hungry -- speciality was not that special to me. only over-priced. also waiting for 20 ,min to get seated. Sporry I won't gp back

Met my family for Happy Hour for the first time and I was greatly impressed.  Happy Hour Sushi is delicious.  I would come back just for the Crazy Boy.  It is a small intimate place yet very family friendly.  Can't wait to go back.

Yen and Wild Tuna seem to be the two best Sushi bars I've eaten at in Phoenix.  Still moving down the list - may have some revising to do. Nothing outstanding, just decent.  I have to admit my coastal bias, having come from the Bay Area.  The stars I give in AZ for sushi are like kindergarten teachers' gold ones - trumped up to encourage further accomplishments by the sushi tykes.

This was our second time at this place . The sushi is very good but, the servers are not aware of customer needs. We asked for Sapporo beer and the server needed us to repeat our request 3 times in order to understand. The servers seemed disorganized. One African American server seemed lazy and not very interested in the customers. She needed encouragement and direction. Almost like she didn't want to be their. Servers are the backbone of a good restaurant. I assumed the owner was one of the sushi chefs. I also heard a conversation on the phone from an unsatisfied customer. My girlfriend is korean and interpreted the conversation. Not good customer relations. If I was the owner, I would care more about customer relations and good staff than overall profit. Owner needs to wake up.

My husband and I ate here for the first time this weekend. We loved it! Best sushi I've had in a while. The prices are comparable to other sushi restaurants but I think the quality and flavors are better. I can't wait to go back!

Paul is the man.  I accidentally stumbled upon this place one day with coworkers for dinner.  We sat at the bar where Paul, the owner and head sushi chef, promptly struck up a great conversation with us.  Ever since, this is a weekly visit for me.    Paul always is honest with his fish, tells me what is fresh and what isn't.  For newcomers, I definitely would recommend sitting at the bar and getting to know the fish.  Thumbs up!

Tonight, I cheated on this place by trying another sushi spot. Huge mistake, There is not a better sushi spot in Phoenix then Yen sushi. Tucked away in a shopping center, looks are deceiving. The food is always fresh and delicious and has yet to disappoint. I am a fan of the nigiri style of sushi, and do not do California rolls. This place is heaven for people who like REAL sushi. I have been a loyal customer to this place since I discovered them a year and a half ago. People who say they can't find good sushi in Arizona have not tried Yen!
This is my favorite local sushi spot! Always tastes super fresh & the service is solid even when they're busy! Try the sunset roll - simple, but so yummy!! Good happy hour selections too!
Love this place!  It's always busy for their awesome happy hour but the service never suffers!  I've been coming here for years and happy to see that they've expanded.
Food is garbage. Service is worse.  $6 happy hour rolls aren't worth $2...

We had heard some good things about Yen Sushi so we decided to try it on a Sunday evening during happy hour. I ordered sushi off the happy hour menu and my companion ordered hamachi kama, which is her favorite Japanese dish. The sushi was good and priced at only $5 a roll. However, when the kama arrived it was not only smallest kama we had ever seen but it was so grotesquely over cooked that it was inedible. When we informed the server she immediately removed it from our bill.
Service is always great here. Sushi is amazing.  I too wish they would expand the happy hour menu but as for the rolls on there....AMAZING. I'm hooked

Thanks to all the positive reviews on Yelp, my girl Danielle & I tried this place out last night.  For a Wednesday night this place was packed! There were 2 parties ahead of us waiting for a table so we opted to sit at the bar.  We started off with sake bombers. Only $5 each! I think we got a good 4-5 shots from it, so good!! I don't have too much experience with sushi so I let D order everything. From the happy hour menu she ordered the crazy boy roll & the philly roll, both only $5 each. From the regular menu she ordered the dragon roll & the yellowtail. These were all a 1st for me. The crazy boy was so yummy, I like it better than crunchy rolls which I used to always get. The philly roll was delicious, all the flavors went together perfectly! I didn't really care for the dragon roll, the eel on top was not appealing to me at all & I spilled some sake on it lol. The yellowtail was by far my favorite, even though it looked really scary when they 1st brought it out! I can't believe how good it was, so simple yet so amazing! I am definitely getting more than 1 order of it next visit.   Our total came out to $42 & some change, what a deal! We will definitely be back, during happy hour of course!!
My favorite sushi place in Phoenix.  Always delicious.  Happy hours are great.

I thought that the sushi was just ok. There are other options within several miles that are much better. One of the most impressive things about the food, was the truly lovely presentation. The servers were skilled and the happy hour was a very good deal so coming to here certainly isn't a waste, however there is tastier sushi in Phoenix.

My brother from San Francisco was in town and missing the sushi from the bay area. I decided I'd let him choose where we'd go out even though I'd never ever heard of this place before. It was definitely in a not-so-glamorous area, tucked on the side of a dinky shopping center (sorry shopping center). When we walked in I was pleasantly surprised by the quaint atmosphere and set-up. It's definitely small but everyone working there and eating there seemed to be genuinely having a great time.   We sat at the bar/long table in front of the sushi chefs which was a fun experience. We started off with sake, and it was pretty darn smooth. We ordered a variety of different dishes including sea urchin eggs, yellowtail shashimi and the king crab roll. They were even accomodating to make my brother dishes that weren't on the menu. The chefs are so nice and fun and the prices are pretty good!  My brother was extremely impressed coming from a top sushi city. I look forward to coming back and trying more of their extensive menu, especially for happy hour.

I moved to Arizona a year ago with my boyfriend. We love small sushi places and couldn't find one until we ate here. If you go during happy hour it is really cheap and delicous!! We go all the time now and are never unhappy! :)
The sushi here is always fresh and taste great. Service is always good and fast. Happy hour is one of the best around! Definitely recommend this place

I am not a sushi eater but all my friends were meeting here, so I thought, I'm in the mood for teryaki chicken so I'll try it out!    I ended up ordering the teryaki chicken roll which had crab it in. Let me tell you, I really enjoyed the mix of something familiar (teryaki chicken) with something new, crab.   The servers were very friendly and funny. They have a good happy hour too!
Ive tried plenty of different sushi places and this is absolutely my favorite. I have never been dissapointed. I have taken many of my friends and family here, and they have all loved it. :)

2nd experience was just awful. Now I went there before with a couple of friends. The experience was awesome and the waiter was always there. He was just great. That was in April 2013. Later on August 2013 I went there with a friend, the service was REALLY bad. This middle age waitress & younger waiter were either afraid of us or didn't want to bother with Black ppl. When I tell you our service felt like a distance. It REALLY did. The waitress was lost in translation half of the time,( ex. " do you have unsweetened tea?" No, we have sweet tea" my friend wanted sweet tea. " oh I want some sweet tea." "No we only have unsweetened tea." ( didn't I just ask if she had unsweetened tea?)  we had to keep flagging them down for assistance...and she couldn't even split the bill right. The guy waiter was a nervous wreck and wouldn't look at us either... We left feeling unsatisfied & still hungry. So we got a nice meal at Chills for 25$

We love Yen's the food is always good and the service is EXCELLENT!  Even when it is crazy busy they are always very attentive!  Everyone is SO friendly! The happy hour menu is a good deal and the house cold sake is YUMMY!

We went to this restaurant on a recommendation from my nephew.  The sushi was excellent!  We've been to quite a few sushi restaurants in Scottsdale, NY and elsewhere and this was was up there with the quality.  Very relaxed but nice atmosphere as well.  We will be returning!

Me and my brother regularly prefer this place over any other sushi place on the west side. The sunset roll when they will make it is our favorite! Have tried most every sashimi and roll on the menu and i really enjoy the non sushi such as the udon noodle with curry. Great service and great atmosphere really a chill spot to enjoy great food.

This place has a top notch tuna tataki app! Great rolls out quick regardless of how busy they are. Excellent service all the way around and very reasonable on price. Green tea ice cream for after dinner treat, I think so!!!! I forgot to mention I was in and out during lunch time spending 20 dollars.

I read great things about Yen and checked it out today for a business lunch. The service was amazing, it's easy to have a quick lunch there, and they have cheap sushi lunch specials, but I was there for a business lunch, and we stayed for 2+ hours. The service was above and beyond excellent. The two ladies serving us were always on standby for whatever we needed, right down to spotting my friend drop his napkin and bringing him a new one before he even realized he dropped it.  The food was incredible. I had read about a scallop appetizer and meant to order that, but instead ordered the Mussels with Dynamite Sauce. What a wonderful mistake it turned out to be. There were six large mussels on the half shell, served hot with a savory Dynamite sauce, scallions and fish eggs. They were excellent. We decided to order several rolls, including the Hot Night roll, the Spicy Tuna Tempura (amazing tempura sweet potato comes with this), and several others, as well as a few pieces of sushi, including the Yellowtail belly, which was delicious and super fresh.   Since our eyes were way bigger than our stomachs, we had our server box up the remaining food and she was kind enough to put the box on ice for me to keep the fish cold! Without asking!!!! In hindsight, I wish I had asked her name so I could put it in this review and give her props. Highly recommended and I will definitely be returning soon!

I can not stand this place during their reverse happy hour, 8-close. They are completely incapable of handling the large amount of customers that come in for this time. I have tried three times now, to visit Yen during this time, and have walked out after waiting 10-20 minutes to be spoken to, or seated. Try Fresh Wasabi 2 miles down the street, much better service, better happy hour, and better selection of fish (including yellow tail).

I have been here perhaps 10 times in the last year and have had varying experiences. The first time I must say was great but several of my experiences thereafter were mediocre. Tonight the food was phenominal! Service was kind of what i expect at any sushi place, friendly but not over the top. I do believe sitting at the sushi bar is the way to go. The chef is awesome and i love the fact he put a couple of kids in their place when they hit the bar for their "sake bombs"! Hands down the best sushi in the area. Love this place!

I have found our sushi joint. Sapporo, Ah-So and all those crappy wannabe Japanese places in Scottsdale has NOTHING on this place. This is a hidden gem.   My husband and I came here on our anniversary which happened to be on Easter.  We came during dinner time and thought it was going to be a full house. It was busy, but not full. Lucky us!   We were seated promptly by our female server. She was very nice and helpful! I was very indecisive because almost everything on the menu sounded delicious! Anyway, we started off with Hana Sake raspberry flavor. It was definitely delicious. My appetizer came first and it was quick! I ordered the octopus salad and husband had the baked mussels. I LOVED both appetizers. I'm very picky about tako salads too! Portion was great and they were each both under $10! I requested my salad to be spicy and the chef made the spiciness up to my level. Bravo!   We shared sushi roll plate. It was the crunchy scallop roll with 2 spicy octopus sushi. Both were delicious as well. With the crunchy scallop, you get extra scallops on the side! Idk what sauce they used but it was godsend. Seriously. My taste buds level went over 9000. Hubby actually wanted to order the sea urchin sushi but they ran out that night. No biggie, we were full as heck anyway. Especially with that chocolate pyramid mousse with caramel.   While we were dining, one of the servers dropped a plate by the customer. Hey, things happen. It's life ya know? What surprises me is that the owner (I believe) immediately cleaned up and was very apologetic. They handled it well, unlike many places I go to. The atmosphere was VERY clean to a T. When you enter it's a bit cramped but the seating isn't.   We also tipped the sushi chefs on top of our server despite not sitting at the sushi bar. They worked hard and we were more than pleased with our food. Thank you guys! We highly recommend this place!

Been to many of the valleys "fancy" sushi spots- the w, pure, etc- this bar far has the freshest fish around.   Shockingly located in a strip mall off bell and the avenues this is a must come too place if you want anything fresh in phoenix! Do not let the curb appeal turn you away!!

The food here is amazing, and the customer service is awesome! You may not be used to the way things work though,  because most of the time you have to wave to them and let them know you are ready.  I like that because it gives me time to decide without someone checking on me every two minutes. I LOVE IT HERE!!!!!

I have tried many sushi places in Arizona and every time I regret that I did not just come to Yen.   They have the best happy hour.  Beautiful interior, wonderful warm atmosphere with that pleasant noisy burble you want from a sushi place.   They somewhat recently added an addition to make it larger. Awesome and it is still always packed.   The fish is the best quality I've  found so far. Nice pink salmon, deeply pink-red tuna. Rice is perfect. Lots of selection and always excellent service.    This is the place to go.  Love love LOVE Yen.

Awesome place. I went today and sat outside, I went for happy hour and it was delicious... the happy hour menu it's freaking good. As I was done my baby woke up and she was hungry too, I asked for a side of the tempura veggies and they told me they only have the appetizer, later I found out they did a side just for me :)  Definitely coming back!

This is by far my favorite sushi place in Phoenix metro area and I've tried A LOT of them. Their Crazy Boy Roll is to die for. They are reasonably priced compared to some sushi places and have SO much to choose from. My 7 year old daughter even likes this place and she's super picky. My wife really really enjoys their curry bowls as well. Overall, the place is clean, friendly and never disappoints. 5+ STARS!!

Tried this place right after we moved into the area and it's amazing! Everything we have tried is delicious. Staff is friendly and very prompt. It can be busy because of the happy hour but you'r never left feeling forgotten. Great atmosphere and just over all great restaurant. My husband and I will definitely continue going to rid restaurant!!
This place was close to home so I would be here every other week or so. Good rolls and the staff was great!! Not much of a  selection for happy hour but the regular menu offers a variety of flavors.

A friend took me here for dinner and I gotta say this is probably the best sushi I've had in a long while. We ordered the fried gyoza for an appetizer, very delicious,   and then we ordered a rainbow roll, shrimp tempura roll, and a fried calamari tempura roll. What was really neat about the two tempura rolls was that it came out on the same plate and it also came with zucchini, sweet potato, and shrimp fried in tempura that was covered in a delicious sweet sauce. I've never received extra at other sushi restaurants like that and it definitely made for a great meal. I will definitely make more trips back to this location in the future!

This place is awesome! The atmosphere is nice and the service is great. The food is amazing and reasonably priced. I think this place is great if you love sushi but don't want to spend a fortune. Also they make good drinks, my gf especially loves the watermelon martini! So yeah, I definitely recommend this place for sushi lovers!
Amazing sushi and amazing service. My sushi is always delicious and they have good portions for fair prices.I haghky recommend their happy hour!!!

Great food and prices! Better service could've given it 5 stars. Because I had a party of 6, it seemed that they relied solely on the courtesy 18% gratuity:( In fact, they we would've tipped much better had they tried harder (they completely forgot I ordered an app, maybe 1 round of refills on water and tea, not once did they ask how the food was). I've worked in the industry for many years in the past and always acknowledge good service and tip very generously when it's even "normal". Sad to see so many people doing less than minimum, thus I also have to acknowledge that too. Industry workers reading this: just try.... I promise it will not go unnoticed.
I'd give this place a 0 if I could.    The service was awful and the food was worse.  Do not come here if you are looking for traditional sushi.
Best place in the Valley! Sunday happy hour is the best. Rolls are delicious and fun. great atmosphere. wonderful service!
Amazing food here! The sushi is some of the best that I have ever had.

I have to admit that this was my favorite sushi restaurant in the Glendale area. Within the past two years, the service was always great. The food is good but on the very expensive side, in my opinion. I came today and the service was horrible. They wanted to charge me extra $5.00 just to switch out a different type of fish on their small trio-sashimi plate that's already $27. The waitress was rude and brought the check while we were still eating. Then another waiter just came straight to our table and grabbed our signed tip receipts while we were still there. I thought that was so rude of them to do that while the customers are still at the table. Have some respect and learn some American manners....please!!!! My other friends were there with me and they will definitely write many more bad reviews for this place!

It was okay sushi but not great (but it's the only place I've tried in Phoenix.  Restaurant was nice inside (four stars there) and everyone was friendly, par for the course at a sushi place.  If the sushi was a little better it'd get an extra star from me.

I go to school right by this place and saw it on yelp a few times but I never got around to going. The other night after picking my girl up at the airport we were aimlessly driving around looking for food after what seemed like hours we settled on sushi and I decided to try Yen. Omg, I had no clue what I was missing! The food here is amazing! My girl ordered the cucumber salad and she said it was just ok. We got 4 rolls; a crunchy roll, 2 California rolls, and a Philly roll. They were all amazing! Before finding Yen we had been to Ra, Zen 32, and Koi but this place is by far the best! My only complaint is that it's too small and too many people know about it so be prepared to wait a while but it is definitely worth it!  Been back a few more times and my opinion has not changed; this place is amazing. without a doubt the best sushi bar in Phoenix!
Great sushi!!! Service was speedy! Quite a few unique rolls to try here! Get here early on the weekends and it got quite busy for the dinner rush! Will be coming back for sure!

This place gets 4 stars from me as far as food concern. It's a little small though and these place is always busy especially if you go around lunch/dinner time. If you live in the West Side and looking for a good restaurant, check this place out. I usually get simple sashimi when I go to sushi restaurant like salmon sashimi and Yen have good salmon sashimi. The tempura rolls and Las Vegas rolls are good as well. For those who don't eat sushi but somehow get dragged to this restaurant, don't worry you have options. I recommend the Korean BBQ ribs. They are tasty and you get a lot of meat too.  **note review is based on my visits prior to my plant based diet**

Prior to last night, I tried Uni (Sea Urchin) once before at a different Sushi place in California and it was terrible. Last night, I decided to give it one more chance @ our favorite sushi spot because I keep hearing how delicious good fresh and ice cold Uni can be. All I can say is holy moly! Yen Sushi & Sake Bar really knows what they are doing. The Uni was by far one of the best bites of sushi I have ever had. Great work Paul!!!! Any time we want sushi, we go to Yen!!!

ALL TIME BEST "Hole in the Wall" Restaurant you'll ever find!!  I've been going here for a few years now and have never been disappointed.  We recently moved to the other side of town so don't get to dine here that often anymore, and I couldn't be more sad about it.    The prices are always good, but during happy hour they are phenomenal!  They do a reverse happy hour also from 8pm-close which is convenient for those of us who work during typical happy hour times.  The sushi chefs are authentic and you can watch them make all the food too.  The only cons about this place are: 1) It can get very busy during happy hour times and on weekends and the wait time can be pretty long.  2)  The location is pretty small/cramped and does not have much room for many people with limited tables, which causes the long wait times.  NOT a good place for groups over 4 people as there is just not enough room for it.  I'd love to see them grow and get a larger space to accommodate more patrons.  I have recommended many people here and have heard nothing but positive things from each of them.  FYI - the Philadelphia Roll here is perfection!
been going there for years EXCELLENT sushi, always served very fast, people are friendly, excellent happy hours, its a hidden gem!!

Really loved this place but now im pissed horrible service! Just tried to call in an order a whole hour before they closed on a Friday by the way you should expect it to be busy dumb asses! We called for 30 minutes straight and they kept hanging up and not answering on purpose! We had a small order and like I said a whole hour are you kidding me thats ridiculous! Cant believe they would turn down business because they are too lazy to do their job also 10 is too early on a friday night anyway you guys have a bar for crying out loud!!
I was not impressed with anything I have had here and probably will not return. The sushi rolls were small and left a sort of weird aftertaste in my mouth. Everything was just okay.

I've been going to yen for 5 years now. Best place in town for sushi! I have literally eaten everything on the menu and it is all great. Our personal favorites though are the sunset roll, the heart attack as an appetizer, the don't cry roll (spicy), and the rock and roll. This place is a must!

Fantastic food. Really fresh sushi. Service can be hit or miss. Last time I went we had to ask twice for silverware and I actually had to get up and get my own napkins. They also brought us the wrong dessert. So you can't go wrong with the food, but you may go wrong with the service.
Yummy and Very Creative Menu ... Beautiful presentation..... Love this place!

A bit small but a good place for a date. It was very clean ...might want to call before showing up on the count of how small it is. My mom dropped a cup and the whole restaurant went silent .If your looking for private and romantic  this isn't the place. A good place to have with friends the location is a bit under the radar but very close to ASU west. Decent price point (during happy hour) and you get a lot in my opinion compared to other places.

My friends and I usually come here for happy hour, which I think they are pretty much famous for.  Food are good, especially the crazy boy rolls.  I am not too much of an alcoholic, but I would recommend the sake bomber since you get more bang for your buck.  Another good thing about their happy hour menu is the cost.  You pay $5 for 1 roll.  Where else can you get a regular sized roll for only $5. I believe they have 2 times each day for their happy hours: 3-5p and 8-close.

It's just very average. If you are craving sushi and nearby it is worth going.   Pros: 1. Sushi is pretty tasty 2. Cute mom and pop (non-chain) restaurant  Cons: 1. The rolls and the sashimi are teeny tiny. Never had such small pieces. Felt ripped off for what I paid.  2. The waitress was miserable and obviously not happy to be there. Makes for a bad dining experience. It was like I was bothering her because I came in to order sushi.  3. Lots of tempura based rolls which could be a pro if you like fried rolls.   I will try others in the area before heading back here. Not bad but nothing special.

I have been driving by for a few months now after moving here thinking this was a tiny little take out sushi place.  After reading the awesome reviews on yelp and not having had sushi in a very long time I figured it was worth a shot. As soon as we walked through the door my husband said "wow".  A full service restaurant with a great atmosphere and decor surrounded us. The service was very attentive and thorough. The food was perfect in every way possible.  Beautiful presentation.  Exceptional flavors and textures.   We ordered the calamari crunch and fresh tuna with ponzura sauce as appetizers and then the fire cracker roll.  I can't wait to go back and try more!

The sushi is actually some of the better we have ever had. In fact, most of their food is actually really tasty. The customer service has been atrocious and on two different occasions. The first time I stopped in here, I was sick and looking to get soup for my family. When inquired if they had any I could buy to go, the manager or owner (not sure) shouted at me in front of customers that I couldn't just order soup and it was a waste of time. I didn't go back for a year. My husband and I just recently went here. We arrived right before happy hour was ending and asked the waitress a question regarding the special. She had to ask someone else about the dish and left us at the table for 15 mins. When she finally came back and we placed our order, we were told we missed the happy hour special bc it was past the time (even tho she was the reason we couldn't order) and they couldn't help us out.
Quality sushi, friendly staff and took advantage with their happy hour specials.  Very happy about a full belly!

Best sushi ever! Great happy hour too. 3-6 and 8-close they have $5 rolls and cheap drinks. They have some unique sushi. My favorite is the heart attack! The environment is really nice too. You won't be disappointed by trying this one!!!
Love there HH but so does everyone else so, it gets pretty packed. I have been on the look out for a good crunchy roll & the crazy boy roll is top of the top right now $5 at HH

Yum. This place has amazing food. Eat here today. Leave now, you won't be disappointed. I came at the recommendation of several of my friends. I was not disappointed. But, I am mad at myself for not coming here sooner.
We tried them for the first time on Christmas Eve and enjoyed the food very much!  Awesome Vegas, Philadelphia, Spider Roll with California's on the side...

Is it possible? Another 5 star review for a Sushi joint? Yes! Yes it is.   I was going to have dinner with my BFAM, Kevin and decided to look up Sushi. I chose Yen due to the great reviews and BOY was I glad that I did.  We were greeted and chose to sit at the sushi bar. I suggested to Kev that we go Chef's choice all the way. Of course my brother said "Hell yeah" to that! The Chef was mildly surprised at the request but quickly warmed up to the idea. If he was aiming to blow our socks off, he was dead on.  There is something about simply made, FRESH food that tends to wow me. He started us off with a sashimi plate to die for. It included salmon, yellowtail, tuna, and octopus. Amazing. Every slice was fresh, not even a hint of being old. The best way to describe the after taste is "Clean", no fishiness or weird after taste. The chef then presented us with thinly sliced striped bass with fresh wasabe. Amazing... amazing! The slices of bass were so thin, you could see the plate underneath. The next thing we ordered was eel. Now, I'm usually not a fan of eel because it seems gritty or greasy to me. When we were served the eel, I was surprised to find nothing of the sort on my plate. It was delicious! The eel was crisp and flaky from the broiling.   The entire meal was great from start to finish. I can't wait to visit Yen again.
Loved everything about this place, the service was great, the sushi was fantastic, and paul at the sushi bar was very friendly.  If you're looking for a new sushi place, this is it...

My boyfriend and myself are regular comers to Yen and have never had a bad experience. We are always greeted with welcoming service and sat almost immediately. Tonight we came in and there was a wait of 30 minutes, according to the hostess, which seemed normal due to 4 groups ahead of us. She then sat us down within less then 10 minutes making it seem like our seating and dinner was important. The food ordered was beyond exceptional, environment enjoyable, but the service was just okay. Our server was nice at first when we gave our order, but didn't seem to come back to our table often leading me to ask the worker cleaning the table next to us for extra napkins instead, and multiple refills. However the workers almost always give much recognition and respect to the customers and make sure unnecessary plates are taken. This place takes their cuisine serious and try to make sure all customers feel appreciated and luxuriate in their meal. Would highly recommend Yen Sushi to anyone who adores sushi, for a deal of a price.

If you want sushi this is the place. Hands down the best mom and pop shop for sushi. You have to try the crazy boy roll it's my all time favorite roll. Staff is friendly and just a great vibe from the moment you walk through the door. Try this place you will not be dissatisfied.

This is a regular lunch stop for us, as we work for a company in the immediate vicinity. I was originally excited to see a sushi bar this close in our area. Over the course of a half dozen visits,  I've quickly come to realize the same issues as the recent posts I've seen below.  The service is certainly lacking. We are always waiting, missing items, incorrect orders, inconsistent cuts of sushi... Lunch is basically a grab bag of "What's going to happen today?".  Now, if you want to roll in and just get a bento box and roll out satisfied, this may be your place. Just don't go in with high expectations.
Since moving from NY I have hunted for a place that make great teriyaki chicken and sushi. This place fits the bill!!  We were in town visiting and we had to have eaten there a half a dozen times...

We were extremely impressed with both the price and the quality offered here. The salmon and spicy tuna rolls were superb. Eel roll was good, the salmon skin rolls were amazing. The Rock & Roll was good, but pretty overpriced as you only get 5 pieces for $10.50  Excellent service, nice decor, and a lovely place to go for lunch or dinner.

The food is really good- the customer relations stink. We've been many times and always enjoyed the food, but the loud dance music, which is played even at lunch time, is clearly for the enjoyment of the employees. The last time we ate here, we asked to be seated away from the overhead speakers. Still, it was so loud we couldn't hear each other, so I eventually asked the waitress to turn the music down. She did, but right away one of the sushi chefs confronted her and angrily turned it back up! Won't ever be back. I'm really tired of restaurants playing music or t.v.s. Some of us actually talk over a meal.

First time here and I must say I'll be back.  We came in at 11:30 and right after we walked in two large groups arrived. So it seems to be a favorite lunch place for groups. The acoustics must be fantastic because with those groups it was still very quiet.  The lunch combo roll is a pretty good deal at $8.99.  This includes miso soup which is light and a nice bringing to the meal. Choice of California roll, spicy tuna or nigiri (1 each salmon, shrimp, tuna). I got the nigiri and all three pieces were delicious. All were fresh with no odd smell or texture. Then you also get another roll with about 6 choices of which I ordered the Alaska roll. Again it was delicious and fresh. The sauce (not sure what it's called) on the side of the plate was slightly sweet with a bit of spice.  So it's a pretty good deal for lunch.  Service was friendly and they weren't pushy or slow even with the three larger groups.  We plan on returning for happy hour at some point.

Yen is the go-to place for Sushi in Arizona. Having been to quite a few places and also living on the coast, I can say their fish is quality. The wait staff can vary, sometimes it's excellent, other times it's not. I enjoy their Albacore and Red Snapper sashimi and their off-the-menu King Crab hand roll (real crab, woot!). If you enjoy quality sashimi, this is an excellent place. If you're into all the fancy mayonnaise-based sushi rolls, you probably won't notice a difference.
Finally found a sushi place that's pushing the limits.  Great stuff going on here.
My favorite place for sushi! Happy hour is the best time to go. The service could be a little better.

My hubby and I are not a sushi fans, so you may think it is odd for us to go to a place like this; however, we have freinds who are fans so we had to find a place that balanced out well for both of us. AND LET ME TELL YOU, this place is amazing. They loved the sushi, my mouth waters whenever I think of the teriyaki and my hubby is always willing to go back and try something g else from them.
Excellent sushi and salmon sashimi, very impressed. Try the Fresh salmon on Spicy Scallop Roll.

I used to come here all the time. The servers used to all know me. It's been awhile since I have been here (the extra space added is nice!) but service has gone down hill! I went for happy hour/lunch so it wasn't very busy. I had to ask two different waitresses twice each for my drink. My waitress seemed more annoyed than anything that I was there and wanting service, and it's not even like I asked for much. The food was ok, but that's the usual they've never been the best. It just used to be a nice place to go especially for their reverse happy hour. With service like that I don't know. We'll give it another try I guess since they used to be decent, hopefully just an off day for her.

Ive been trying a couple different sushi places and i think for the price and taste this is the best ive had thus far.  if you go during happy hour you wont regret it.  me my brother and my 2 cuzns pig out here and i mean pig out for about 60 bucks.

I had the udon and a Phoenix roll.   My Phoenix roll wasn't bad.. but not anything I'd ever get again.  This place was sub par.   Udon was okay. For some reason the broth was a little sweet?   Everyone at the table couldn't understand how this place had a 4 star rating when it should be more like a 2.5  Thanks!

Stopped here for some sushi on our way back to Tucson. We chose this place because it was one of the only sushi places with a patio that allowed dogs. Service was ok. There were a few points when I wished they would refill drinks. I think it may have been different if we had been sitting inside.  Food was great! We had a group of 5 and we all order sushi and shared. The spicy rolls actually had a good kick to them. The rolls all tasted fresh. Of all of them my favorite was the spicy scallop roll. I would definitely come back if I was in the area again!
Amazing sushi and happy hour, favorite rolls are the baked scallop and the Philadelphia roll! Atmosphere awesome and staff is too legit to quit!

This place kicks! Have never had a bad meal here or bad service. Sushi rolls are always fresh. The best is they have reverse happy hour from 8PM to Close with a nice selection of discounted rolls and beers.

Their sushi is really good.  We got the Hawaiian roll with the seered albacore tuna.  The flavor was really good and held up to the wasabi.  The warm baked salmon roll with sour cream was even better.  Teriyaki roll was just okay.  The service was just plain bad.  When you only order 3 dishes and all you have to do is take an order and deliver one dish for each person.  What do you do on your free time?  Surely not forget my miso soup and forget to give me my wasabi.  There were a total of 4 tables to attend to for 2 waitresses.  I had to tell the waitress about refilling my tea and bringing my wasabi midway through my dish when I could not stand being thirsty.  The older lady got sounded agitated when I asked her about the soy paper for some strange reason and said it was an extra dollar.  I told her I was just wondering...jeez!  Nevertheless, they did not deserve any tip, but we did tip around 7%.  We are ordering take out from now on.  They have good food and this latest visit was just bad compared to other previous mediocre visits.

My friend had taken me here, i have been to plenty of sushi bars and restaurants, but this one is special, this one is the best.   First off, the prices. They are unreal fair. When i looked at the tab, I actually said, that's not bad at all.   But more than that, the sushi is simply amazing, my unagi plate presentation was crazy, served on a sizzling plate, it defiantly had the whole restaurant staring. The crunchy tuna roll was fantastic along with the sashimi.  If you have friends that don't like sushi and have never tried it, take them here, it will make them think twice!

Yen is a fantastic choice for anyone needing their sushi fix. That's the best thing going for them, their food. Hands down the best eel I've ever had in town and close to the best oyster shooters I've taken. The green muscles are hands down the best appetizer I've had in any sushi joint. The chefs behind the bar are also very friendly and don't mind drunken people talking their ear off while working. The only problem with yen is that its really only worthwhile during the happy hour's they have and at that time it's almost impossible to get a seat without waiting and don't even try to get to the bar during those times. So your forced to sit at a table and be waited on by sub-par waitresses. Out of the 20 or so times I've been there I've had great service maybe 3 times at a table. Slow on refills and even refusing to split a check for my party on numerous occasions. But you take the good with the bad and I would recommend this place over any huge sushi restaurant with flash any day.

Ok.  So you had a rough week.  It's Friday night.  You are in the mood for some great sushi, but not looking forward to hurting the pocket.  And BOOM!  You hear Yen Sushi & Sake Bar has an AMAZING happy hour deal after 8 pm.  I mean cheap appetizers, about half off on sushi, and great prices on drinks.  All I am going to say is for a party of 4, we had:  2 appetizers 6 rolls of sushi 2 specialty drinks for the ladies 2 sake and beers for the dudes  Total amount came to $62!  Ok, with your mouth dropping, and thinking, "the food probably wasn't that good, right?"  Well, you have to be wrong, my fellow yelper.  The appetizer tempura was not overly breaded, and you can really taste the vegetables with the light crunch from the tempura.  The gyoza had some rough texture on some, but when bitten it was tender and flavorful.  Now to the sushi.  For the price, it was above average.  Well organized and presented.  Tasted fresh, therefore, it was some quality sushi.  As a result, great deal for happy hour, which I will definitely come back to.  It is a small environment in not the best looking shopping center.  However, the service was good even though it was definitely busy.  I would strongly recommend coming 10-15 minutes before happy hour to beat the line.  Excellent DEAL, and looking forward to another evening at Yen Sushi & Sake Bar!

Another Sushi bar run by friendly Koreans. This one though, is a step above the others.  The chef (and owner I think) Paul, was incredibly friendly and explained how he uses only quality ingredients - especially in the reasonably priced and delicious small sashimi platter ($27). You can tell that quality is important to Chef Paul.  The Happy Hour specials (every day 3-5pm) keep bringing us back for the $5 rolls - Salmon and Shrimp rolls and $3 large Sapporo are our favorites.  We also tried the baked scallop cheese appetizer ($8)and it was simply sinful.
Hands down best sushi in town. They have a awesome happy hour too. I try to eat here 2-3 times a week.

Sushi that leaves an impression and that's what's getting 5 stars. It's just good and the staff is nice.  Prices are reasonable for happy hour and the space is decent. Usually the main room is filled and often it spills over into their additional space. So don't be discouraged by the groups of people entering in front of you. It's a tight squeeze but there's always a table somewhere.

This place used to be my favorite sushi bar in Phoenix. I've lived all most Asian countries including Japan so I believe I have a well rounded insight into quality Japanese cuisine.   This place has really gone downhill in the last few months. The servers and the sushi chef must have had a horrible day because I was largely ignored by the waitress and the sushi chef cut the sashimi portions in half. I was a regular there and at each visit, the size of sashimi slices kept getting smaller and smaller. During my last visit, the fish slices were wafer thin. To make matters worse since I was ignored by the waitress, I confronted the sushi chef and showed him how he used to prepare my sashimi deluxe platter and what he actually made me. The sashimi was literally dumped on my plate and was lacking the usual beautiful presentation. His response was that he was busy and that we had a large table. I told him this was unacceptable and he proceeded to give me this idiotic "Alfred E Neuman" look.   The server never gave me my sake without me chasing her down and she also forgot to give me my side order of rice. This server never smiled once.   I will never, EVER go back to his place. It doesn't matter if you're a regular, they'll still treat you like crap!  And by the way, if you're in a group, be wary of the 20% gratuity that is added to your check. Most ppl don't notice this. My service was so bad that I asked for my 20% back and told them to shove it and left.

Crunchy Spicy Tuna!!! Oh so Delicious!  I underestimated Arizona....This place was just awesome!  They have the best happy hour I have seen even in LA. $5.00 beers and $5.00 sushi 8pm-close. Yup we closed the place.   It a small little whole in the wall restaurant that is located in a shopping center next to a subway.  We arrived here after our 7 hour Drive from LA to AZ. The place closed at 10...i think, but we arrived at 11:15 and they still let us order food and beer! YAY Even after we were done....they let us order dessert! Excellent Service and Awesome Staff.   Oh Yen Sushi...You had me at Hello....

Great lunch sushi special: Two rolls (spicy tuna + one from a separate list) + miso soup for $9.  I came here with my brother and sister for lunch after we had gone carting nearby. The service was excellent and we all ordered the lunch sushi special. Spicy tuna roll was sooo good. Fortunately, my brother couldn't finish his, and I obviously couldn't let it go to waste! lol! ;P  I also had the yellowtail/scallion roll which was fresh and delicious as well. For appetizers, we got the cucumber salad and squid salad. Both huge portions (especially the squid salad) and tasty!  They had a pretty extensive menu with lots of other rolls. Mmm...will have to come back here next time I'm in PHX.
Great food, but, there is always a butt... Service was strangely strange.. Servers were friendly enough, but, inconsistent.
Hella good! The happy hour prices are great and the rolls aren't skimpy! The service is pretty good too. I enjoyed this better than Fresh Wasabi.

Although my local Yen Sushi is now long gone out in Los Angeles, I was happy to see Yen in Phoenix while I was visiting. I popped in around 3:30 in the afternoon, hoping their happy hour was in effect, and it definitely was. The happy hour sushi menu is a little more spartan than the one I remember from Los Angeles, but the good stuff was on here and I was happy. At $5 a roll, you can't really go wrong... and I was starving. I snagged a crispy tuna, tempura shrimp, and a chili crab roll. Everything was fantastic, and prepared well.   The chili crab was the star of the show. It came out piled high with lightly tempura battered jalapeno slices. The entire plate was a mound of crunchy, tasty little jalapenos with a crab roll underneath. I sat and ate the whole plate of chillies one by one when the rest of my meal was done. They were delicious. Sure, that might seem sadistic to some, but they were pretty tame on the heat, and really over the top with flavor.   Great meal. Just what I was looking for, and perfect to combat an entire day of driving through the desert. Oh, and the waitstaff was on point. Very attentive, very friendly, and made sure I was well taken care of. Thanks, Yen.
Outstanding!  I would write a longer review, but I'm busy having the best sushi in the valley. This place had good reviews, so we tried it. I'm so glad we did!

This is my go to place! Been here over 25 times and it always satisfies. Favorite waitress Yuri is always providing excellent service! Happy hour is the time to go 3-5 and 8-close, believe me your bill will be half the price of what it would normally be.   5 star all day! New waitresses are a little bitchy but the food is so good I guess I'll deal with the occasional eye roll when I ask for a refill. I need to figure out Yuri's schedule because she never fails to provide outstanding service!

We have been here twice now and have had great food AND great service both times.  Have not been during happy hour, but left around when it was starting and there was a line out the door.  It's a very small but clean and nicely decorated sushi bar.  Not a big fan of the raw stuff, but have tried some of their specialty baked rolls and they are delicious.  My favorite is the Teriyaki chicken roll and the heart attack.  They only serve soda in a can, which is the only negative I found in this small little strip mall Sushi bar!  So go try it!

Great service. Thank you Jasmine. You made our night! Thank you!    Yet another night here and the fabulous Jasmine and baby boy, sorry don't know his name.  Love this place.  Love the Jasmin  Another great night.  Got our favorite server Jasmine. Happy hour rocks too. Sorry Jas I can't figure out how to post our picture!

Yet another disappointing sushi restaurant in the desert. My date and I went here for their late happy hour on a Friday night. I noticed it was hard for larger parties to get a table. There isn't much space between tables. I played it safe and ordered a plate of salmon nigiri. I noticed there wasn't a large selection of raw fish. We ordered the peach soju and the spicy tuna tempura off the happy hour menu. I thought I would be getting a peach soju that's of a thicker substance, but it ended up being soju mixed with some peach sweetener that killed the alcohol. Maybe it was my mistake of ordering soju at a sushi joint. The spicy tuna tempura was a spicy tempura roll deep fried in tempura batter and then sauces drizzled all over each piece that was cut. I couldn't taste any kind of kick from the roll. STAY AWAY from the happy hour rolls.   What i think might be helpful is describing what's in each roll, rather than listing all the rolls on a sheet of paper for you to choose and its quantity. I'm so used to going to sushi restaurants that give you free miso soup, salad, and gyoza. These tend to be the cheapest items on the menu to prepare. Giving these out might keep customers coming back.   I won't be back.

I am giving this a review keeping in mind what this place is: a charming little sushi restaurant wedged into a strip mall in an older Phoenix neighborhood.  I have tried to come here and been dissuaded by a wait for seating in the past. This place is smaller - in a cozy way - and there is a reason it is full.  Reverse happy hour specials, great service, generous portions, and high quality rolls make it a place worth visiting again!  You will forget that you are in a strip mall once you are seated. Our server was attentive to the happy hour sake bombs and wine, and the guests (lots of younger people) were definitely happy to take advantage of this.  Much of the happy hour rolls consisted of tempura rolls - not my favorite - but the price was good and everything was fresh. We ordered a Phoenix roll (written on a board as a "special") and that, along with the quail eggs, were the highlight of the meal.  Don't be afraid to venture off the happy hour menu and try some amazing work-of-art rolls!  I can see coming here again - happy hour or not - and venturing outside my box. There was not a single thing we ordered that wasn't amazing.

Ambiance and layout of restaurant is small and pretty chill. Happy hour goes from 8pm to close which means sake bombers for 5 bucks, philli and a couple other rolls for 5 bucks, and some other specials for good pricing. Again, four stars because of a lack of that "blow my socks off" x factor

The sushi is pretty decent for what you pay for (given that it's no high end sushi like Roka Akor) but then I always believed you usually get what you pay for. The line however is ridiculous, especially if you are trying to catch their "happy hour" special. For me, the menu items were better than the happy hour if you are willing to pay just a little bit more. Service is also a little lacking. But having been in AZ for the past couple months, I've grown to loosen up my Los Angeles standards.

Went here for the first time for work lunch and must say, the first impression was not bad.   I am glad that there is a decent sushi place by my work.   Service was really good, food was good, and I am planning to go back for sure. I ordered their bento box and I was impressed as it does come with a lot of food. Besides sushi, my favorite item out of the box was their tempura vegetables.   One ting I did not like is how cold it was in there. I was shivering the entire time. When I go back, I will bring a blanket :-)
I went there during happy hour, and tried all kinds of things off the menu, they were all good , and the service was good as well. Nice place to go for sushi.

This place is kind of dark, but I think that's what makes it a good place to get sake (convenient if you get asian glow). We didn't get any sake on this visit, but it says $5 sake bombs during happy hour. Therefore, I would definitely come back during happy hour because the rolls can get pretty expensive here. I got the Spicy Scallop & Salmon Roll ($11.95). The salmon was fresh and the roll was good, it was just so darn expensive! I wanted to try the seaweed salad as well, but as I was ordering I realized it was $8 so hastily changed to edamame for $3. All in all, a good place to come to happy hour with friends. Lots of tables (with cushions) and seats at the sushi bar.

2nd favorite sushi spot on the north side.  Yen is on the NE corner of 43rd Ave and Bell.  It is in a strip mall (what else in AZ).  The inside is pretty small.  Maybe sits 8 at the sushi bar and another 25 inside.  There are a few tables on the "patio" as well.  It's not much of a patio.  A barred off small section right out front.  The inside is quaint and nice.  There are a few TVs and a wall of bottles behind the sushi chefs.  It can get rather loud with conversation inside but it reminds me of a crowded local spot in NY more than a typical sad empty AZ restaurant.  We were seated very quickly after they cleaned a table off.  One of the worst ways to welcome a customer is with a wet table.  I am glad you cleaned the table from the previous guest but I am not happy to put my hands and arms on a wet table that was cleaned with a rag that may have been dropped on the floor or used on 20 other tables.  That is just disgusting to me and inexcusable to do.  Take the extra 30 seconds and a clean dry towel and clean it off properly before you seat a customer.  I used a napkin and requested another.  Very poor form.  We first ordered drinks.  I'm a big beer connoisseur and was a little disappointed in their Japanese beer selection.  The usual suspects were on the menu: Sapporo, Ashahi, Kirin Ichiban.  Basically the Bud Light of Japan.  I was hoping for some Koshihikari Echigo or Orion but beggars cant be choosers on the NW of PHX.    We ordered a couple of apps: Edamame and Tofu with Yuzu sauce.  The edamame was a bit cold and not very fresh.  The tofu with Yuzu sauce was pretty tasty.  The tofu was covered in bonito flake which I love and sprinkled with green onion.  The sauce was delicious.  I would have liked an extra pour all over it.  The tofu was good but would have been better if it was a little softer.  It would have soaked up the sauce more if it had been.  Next we ordered tuna sashimi, a phili roll, a dragon roll, and a teriyaki chicken bowl.  The tuna was very fresh and absolutely delicious.  Melted on your tongue and was pure as tuna Ive had in this town.  The phili roll was a bit much for me.  All I could taste was cream cheese but in fairness I am not a fan of phili rolls in general.  The dragon roll was out of this world.  It was about 2 inches thick in diameter.  The eel was the larges slice of eel I have ever been served on a roll before.  The crunchy shrimp inside with the sweetness of the eel sauce around was amazing.  Definitely the highlight of my meal.  The teriyaki chicken was also very good.  Tender flavorful and fresh.  Loved it.  The waitress would disappear for a bit but you can tell she was very busy.  The place was packed and there were only two of them and they were busting their backs pretty well.  I would definitely come back here again thanks to the yuzu sauce with bonito flakes, dragon roll, tuna, and teriyaki chicken.    It would make them pretty close to a 5 in my book if they didnt seat you at a wet table, added a couple gems to their beer selection, and made the tofu a tad bit creamier.  Looking forward to trying out other items.  If you are nearby and looking for sushi look no further!

I am always hesitant to try new Sushi restaurants, but because this was right by the house I used to live in at the time, I decided to check it out.  First, their to go menu is like a CD booklet.  Full pictures, full color, fully AMAZING.  I don't know if they still give these out, but if so, grab one.  Second, sit at the bar.  Don't eff around and sit at a table hidden in the back.  You lack the action of the frontal plain and you miss out on the opportunity to meet new people and possibly get the hook up on free samples.  Third, Paul, the main chef, is awesome!  He is always very friendly, very personable, and has many interesting stories.  One time I went in here for lunch and he helped me learn to use chops sticks (I know, this is SO embarrassing and pathetic on my behalf, especially considering the amount of sushi I eat, but somehow I blame it on being a lefty).  Although I was not able to master the technique he provided, I will never forget the personal attention he gave to us.  Fourth, the food.  Well, it's obviously delicious otherwise I wouldn't have rated it as such.  I know that certain fish cuts are seasonal, but I seem to be slightly disappointed when Toro is not available, and it is rarely available here.  Their Yellowtail Sashimi is wonderful.  I guess I can't really pick a favorite, but they do have a large selection of rolls available.  Fifth, ambiance.  Dark, quaint, I love the wall paper behind the bar.
This place is amazing. The Palm Spring roll and Calamari Tempura roll are my favorites. The ambiance is nice to. They have great lunch specials.

Love this place! Will drive out of my way, personally best sushi place I've been too. Been coming for years, happy they expanded their dining room.  Smells a little weird, service is whatever, but food is SO worth it. Pretty sure owner is actually Japanese.

Holy Mackeral. Dare I say this is the best sushi place that I've tried so far...even though I'm from the Bay area, even though this is Glendale? Yes!  I'm going to make a list so it's an easier break-down:  1. Instant I come in I get greeted by Japanese (yes, Japanese speaking sushi chefs from behind the sushi bar). (GASP!).. Rarely seen, I know. You know the fish and sushi is fresh and authentic when you have native tongue working here. Big thumbs up for the fresh fish is displayed behind the counter in glass, showing the chefs making it in front of you (which I miss!) Very authentic Japanese dishware and furniture throughout.  2. Very attentive, non-obtrusive waitresses and hostess. Paid attention to the amount of food I was ordering (apparently way too much), and suggested appropriately.  3. Bento box (salmon, rice, tempura, miso soup,california rolls) for only $7.99? I remember the last time I ordered this is Cali, it was $10+. This must be wrong...can it  possibly be this cheap AND good? It was ridiculous delicious. The sweet, flakey salmon that melted in my mouth paired so well with the rice, with bits of sesame. I'm in heaven. Only thing I would change is just to make the porportions a tad bigger..  3. Ambiance has modern music, to a low level, not disturbing or loud. Fresh and clean scent throughout the place, didn't reek or raw tuna or over-powering teryaki sauce. Great AC when it starts getting warm outside.  4. For dessert: Green tea icecream for just $3? Great!! Oishii..  They actually said good-bye to me AND smiled? Wow, reminds me of San Jose, CA. Left here with a full stomach, wallet, and a great friday to look forward to.
It wasn't that good.  The fish didn't at all seem fresh.  I think it was frozen and subsequently thawed.  Hmmm.  Maybe just a bad visit.  But I'm surprised at all the positive reviews.

I want to say this is probably the greatest sushi spot I've ever had. The staff is fantastic always coming to you asking if you need anything. The sushi was fantastic the flavors. The worker helped me out choosing what to get. Whoever wants a good sushi spot I recommend this place over any other place. Also happy hour 3-5 is amazing.

Looks like I have to agree with my friend Deb L.  I too wanted to like Yen since it's pretty close and I really got excited about all the positive reviews.  Though, sorry Deb-I don't mind cans of pop :) So, I have their spicy pork bento box and my buddy had a couple rolls.  The rolls were a disappointment I could tell, just not quite what she's used to.  She also complained about an immediate potty trip upon arriving home, despite my explaining it's impossible for food to travel through your digestive system in a half hour.... I had the spicy pork bento, I don't think I left quite as disappointed but I'd call the pork oily before I called it spicy.  The usual accompaniments (miso, salad, etc.) were pretty blah I thought.  And I do agree it's pricey especially considering the mostly abandoned strip mall location across from a Whataburger...
Dishes ordered were worth the price. Restaurant is clean and inviting. Service is just okay.

Was not impressed. The sushi was ok nothing great. The waitress barely spoke a word to us. Came with our check after we only ordered 3 rolls to split and didn't even ask us if we were done. We weren't. But we are now.

Yen is a place of quality for me when it comes to sushi. I am never disappointed by the freshness and quality of the sashimi. Also when I do go for the sushi rolls, I get their crazy boy roll which is a tempura California roll amazing!
My daughter and I have been here twice, and loved both trips. The food, prices and service are consistently good.
The best sushi restaurant in Arizona! Happy hour at 8 pm every day! $5 sushi rolls!!!! Count me in!

A cozy little gem of sushi restaurant in a strip mall. Felt comfy from the moment my hubby and I walked through the door and sat at table on a Monday night. Nice selection of sushi named in the menu, reasonable prices, very fresh fish, great quality, quick and attentive service and super tasty! Just had the basic scallop sashimi, volcano roll and shrimp with crab in soy paper roll. We enjoyed our meal immensely. Great selection of sake available as well. We will be back and be sitting at the bar.

Good food.. Lunch special till 3 happy hour 3-6.. Gyoza were excellent, teriyaki beef good,  sushi was to spicy for my sons liking but became a prefect take hm for family.. No free refills on soda..they don't tell you that. Clean modern  will try again. The waitress was not friendly but wasn't rude either.  I'll update if we end up going back.
Udon noodles soup is great on a cold day. Sushi is pretty good. Rice could have used a few more minutes cooking but good over all.  Nice place for a fast lunch with excellent and prompt service.

Yen Sushi offers great bento boxes for lunch at $8.99. Choose from beef teriyaki, salmon teriyaki, Korean Kalbi ribs and a couple of other choices. They even offer a sushi roll bento.  We ordered a beef teriyaki bento, salmon teriyaki bento and a sushi roll deal.   Beef teriyaki: Miso soup with a good amount of tofu, ginger salad with a large wedge of tomato, carrot and zuchini tempura with sauce (no shredded radish), 4 pieces of California roll, rice and bulgogi marinated beef with a dash of teriyaki.  Salmon teriyaki: Same fixings as above. They portion of salmon was on the larger side. Nice grill, but chef was a little heavy handed on the soya sauce which took away from the teriyak marinate.  Sushi roll meal: No ginger salad. I chose 3 pieces of nigiri instead of the california roll or spicy tuna roll. For my specialty roll, I chose yellowtail tuna with scallions. The rolls was fresh and delicious.  My favorite part of the meal was the soft shell crab roll for $9.95. It was pretty, crunchy and tasty. The finishing sauce was a perfect amount.  Our server was friendly, and we enjoyed the meal. We will be back.

Disappointing. Went here today; service was  all over the place. We got our sushi first, miso soup second and appetizers last. Be cautious; spicy tuna is my staple but they use bone scrape tuna and that is low grade, gross tuna flake meat scrubbed of the bones. The king crab came out half filled with rice and it was $6.50. Don't cut corners and jip customers. We won't be back, there are better quality places around the valley.
One of my favorite sushi places. The sushi is always fresh and presented nicely. You must try the grilled bbq shorts ribs, so delicious. We also love the flavored soju.

Yen is amazing! Great happy hour, great service and great quality of food compared to any sushi place I've been and for such a cheap price! Recommend this place to anyone who wants sushi! None compare!

Great food!!!! Food was wonderful!!! Half ass service acted liked she was annoyed taking orders. Walked away halfway between our drink orders. Had to re order drinks for half our party. Told her we were ordering more food, she still brought the receipt. Got mad and wadded the receipt up when we ordered more food. Great food but terrible, terrible service... Straight up amateur hour service!!! Next time I'll go where they appreciate us as customers!!! Food was amazing so they get a 3!!

I come here all the time for my lunch break. They have awesome customer service! The girls already recognize me because I'm always there! Their crazy boy roll is amazing! As well as their veggie roll. They are fast even during lunch hour where it gets pretty packed. They've never messed up on an order and they are checking occasionally to see if you need anything else. It's a must try if you're in the area!

I think this place is way overrated for the food and service. The best thing I had was the stir-fried curry udon noodles. The dishes I had with fish were nothing special. Sashimi pieces were cut very small and were a little fishy. Only a few items are on the happy hour menu, and they're probably not the good ones you'd want to try anyways.

My very last supper in Phoenix was at Yen Sushi & Sake, omakase all the way. The experience at Yen is top-notch and the staff is on point.
