The $10.50 Rock & Roll on the right side of photo #2 was just slightly larger diameter than a normal-sized sushi roll, but there were only five pieces, so it was about the same volume as their other miniature rolls. The cucumber wrap was fresh and tasty.  Unfortunately that was the only detectable taste. The ingredients were completely flavorless.   So, overall I'd say the food would be a good value at about 40% of the asking price. I would have rated this experience with just one star, but the pleasant ambiance was worth a second star.   Unless something drastically changes, like perhaps new management, I definitely won't return.

We've been to a lot of sushi places in Phoenix and this is now the only one we eat at. The atmosphere is lovely, the service is always excellent and the variety and quality of the sushi is as good as anything we've had. My favorite roll is the Palm Springs Roll, which is made awesome by the large chunks of tuna atop the roll. It's a meal in itself. Plus, if you bring a non-sushi eating friend, you can trick them into eating the very delicious Beef Teriyaki Roll, also a meal in itself.  The happy hour menu includes their crispy tuna, which is a lovely little dish.

They are a favorite spot for me and my guy. They have a regular happy hour and a reverse happy hour that starts at 8pm. They also have great lunch specials. When you go I highly recommend the calamari tempura roll it is so good! It is even on their happy hour menu.

I've been coming to Yen about 3 years now.  Ive learned to wait til the evening happy hour for better service.     Try not to get the older woman its like she looks down on you even though your tipping her.

I've tried a lot of sushi places in Phoenix, but this is my FAVORITE!  The best AND worst part about Yen Sushi: they have great specials every night after 8pm. They place a lot of their quality rolls on "happy hour" for only $5! The bad part about that? It's crowded! This is a small sushi bar tucked in a strip mall-type setting, so when they fill up there isn't much room to wait for a table.  It didn't get 5 stars from me because of the service. It's lacking! Even when tables are open, expect to wait at least 5 to 10 minutes before you are greeted. When you ARE seated, refills usually come only when you ask for them.  Overall, this place is exceptional. Sure the service may need some improvement but you can't beat the quality of the food, the specials they offer, and the inviting environment. Give it a try, you'll love it!

My husband and I love Yen. When we first started going there it was a much smaller place, they have $5 happy hour from 3-5 then 8 to close. The $5 happy hours rolls have expanded, and so has the restaurant.  They have gotten much busier and its so great to see a small business do well!  The staff is great and when they are packed the weight still isn't too long.  If you go try the hot green tea!!! Its great!

Sushi is awesome here! I love the rolls they create! The staff is so friendly and I've never had a problem with our order. I've been eating here for sushi for the past 6 or 7 years. It also just expanded which I love! The happy hour is the best too! And the lunch menu deal is awesome too! Try the crazy boy roll!
Place is the awesome friendly staff and clean facility. I've been here about 5-7 times and each time was just as good as the first time.

I come here all the time. It's the best! The rolls here are very good! Every birthday I come here with all my friends, at least 20! The staff is very accommodating and its just absolutely my favorite place. The happy hour prices are better than anybody else around and they do great birthday parties! I get the Dragon roll and every time it's just prefect! I recommend this place to everyone who loves sushi!
Come after 8 and do not expect fast service, but it's very worth it!!! The best Sushi in North Phoenix / Glendale.

Good sushi, tea that tasted like dirt.  I was feeling sushi, so I iPhoned the place that had the best reviews around and found Yen.  It was a small storefront in a strip mall, but had great sushi.  Prices were normal, and they had some good specialty rolls that unique and tasty.  I was feeling a little non-H1N1-cold sick, so instead of some sake and beer, I opted for some hot tea.  It smelled like dirt and tasted exactly the same. Not like it was gross or funny tasting...it tasted like dirt, topsoil, terra firma. I am not a Japanese tea connoisseur  so I didn't send it back, because I thought maybe it was sort of special herbal healing dirt tea, I don't know.  Otherwise good sushi!  If any fellow yelpers has any say on that, dirt teat thing, I'd love to hear it.
You cannot beat the quality and price of their lunches. $9 for bento boxes or sushi combos 7 days of week!  My kids and us love this place!

Absolutely amazing sushi restaurant. The staff was very friendly and attentive, the food came out in a reasonable time, and it tasted amazing. The rolls were well made and definitely work of art. Beautifully made! The price was also very reasonable.
Love our cozy sushi restaurant. Food is always fresh and delicious. Love their hot tea.
This place is soooo good. Their sushi is delicious and I have yet to have a bad experience here! Very yummy id recommend it to anyone.

This review unlike (some of) my other ones will be short and simple. Comes down to the question - Do you want some super yummy sushi? Then - YES - do come to Yen - you will not be disappointed! Yet to try their Happy Hour - just afraid that I will be in big trouble not knowing when to stop eating at HH... lol

Have been going to Yen for over 3 years and we have never been disappointed. Yuri and her team really make us feel at home remembering what our favourites are and recommending any new items or specials. We never go during happy hour as we prefer their main menu and always way less crowded. We have tried many other sushi bars here in town and found a few other good/great locations but find we return here more often than not!

100th Review -- Very well deserved 5 starts goes to...  YEN SUSHI!  The happy hour here was amazing. We came here while waiting for a friend at the hospital and decided to grab sushi. We're used to great sushi in phoenix, tempe, scottsdale, etc. Never thought such tasty sushi could exist in Glendale, of all areas!  We sat outisde, which was nice, and were quickly served everything we could possibly ask for, promptly. They had nice chopsticks -- I remember these things. Anwyay, we always get eel rolls of some sort which were delicious. The edamame was tasty, the service was amazing, and the food was expertly made and fresh fresh fresh!  Would love to come back when I for some crazy reason end up on this side of town.

Never before on the mainland have I had sushi that has made me stop and really, and I mean, REALLY savor the flavors. Like the world slows down "Matrix-style", grinds to a halt. It's that good.  The last place that did that to me was a small place hidden in a business complex in Maui called Sensei, and since then, I have not had that experience.  Until now. Run out of strip-mall, a Korean Chef named Paul runs Yen Sushi & Sake Bar, and creates some of the most interesting and delicious sushi I have had the pleasure of having.  First off, the nigiri is very fresh, we had Spicy Scallops , Uni, & Smoked Salmon. The Spicy Scallops were exceptionally surprising, because the spicy sauce was not mayo-based, like EVERY OTHER SUSHI BAR EVER does. The result was nothing short of amazing.  The smoked salmon was melt-in-the-mouth delicious, and the Uni ranks as the best I have ever had. All roe, very sweet, and not over-powering at all.  For their Maki, we had the Heart Attack, which is basically the greatest Jalapeno Popper I have ever had. Extremely spicy Jalapeno, spicy tuna, real crab, and some sauces, deep-fried. Decadent.  Delicious.  Our other roll was one that was a mixture of fish, I believe tuna, mackeral ,crab, mountain carrot, a few other veggies, and some eel sauce. Very fresh, and incredibly awesome.  Delicious tea, and free miso, on top of an amazing atmosphere and an incredible chef, have made Yen the ONLY sushi bar that I will continually come back to in Phoenix.

God I miss this place. We started going about 2 months back and have been a regular there , at least once a week since finding it via Yelp. I'm in Scotland for three weeks and there's apparently nothing as good as this venue.   While this may not be important to people this was by far the "fastest" turnaround from order to table, flowed nicely and didn't end up like the usual traffic-accident-at-sushi-central  that we've had on the tiny tables at Tokyo Lobby, or the table shuffle dance at  Fresh Wasabe    The entrance shows an attention to detail that appears throughout the room.  I'm still new to sushi so the chance to try as much of it as I can for reasonable prices has been a winner.  After 8 o clock the happy hour,till close, has many interesting rolls for $5 and large Sapparos ,bottle,for $3.The latter is a public service that should be recognised by the good people of Phoenix and awarded a Yen Sushi day. Love the staff, the food's been great..   The sashimi tuna in garlic aioli sauce appetizer is amazing, yeah it's not cheap but with the happy hour on it pays off nicely to experiment. I can't wait till I'm back stateside again:)

This place was so good!  The staff was on top of everything constantly, we never had to ask for a thing.  The food was AWESOME! and trust me fellow yelpers, we practically ordered everything on the menu.  We ordered noodles and ribs and rolls and rolls and rolls....you get the point!!!!  EVERYTHING was soooo good!  This place is a GEM!!!

Yen Sushi is my favorite (korean style) sushi up in the N. phoenix area. Now mind you i have to give this stars based off of other places here in AZ.. If i was to grade them against sushi places i have been to in other places it would round out at 2 stars. But for this area yeah a four star.  Happy hour here is the best time to come, but also the worst. Best because the deals and the food. Worst because its PACKED! you gotta get here early if you can.   I definitely don't mind dropping by this place to hit my random sushi craving. Its good enough to satisfy my pallet.  Fried rolls are good, but their fresh rolls are better.  I enjoy the staff as well. They are willing to talk and joke with you and don't act like they have a stick up their butt.

Went around 3pm with a friend. Sat at a sushi bar. There were 2 other people sitting couple seats down. Where are sushi chefs? Maybe they went to have lunch...   We ordered hot tea to start. Where is the happy hour menu? Do you have to ask for it to get it? Anyway, we just had regular menu.  We ordered Tuna, Halibut, Salmon, Octopus sushi, Albacore sashimi, and Dragon Roll ($14.00) Shrimp tempura appetizer.  Few minutes later, sushi chef (Paul) came out. It was weird he didn't say anything. No greeting, no how are you doing, no "irasshai" (typical greeting in Japanese). He sliced albacore sashimi and served it to us. It had garlic ponzu sauce on it. It was tasty, but the garlic was over powering the actual fish flavor. Shrimp tempura came next. It was heavy and soggy. Tempura is supposed to be fluffy and crispy. Tuna sushi was next. I had one piece and gave my friend the rest (5 pieces). Fish itself tasted fine, but the way chef sliced it made it fishy. He sliced it along the grain, not against it. Same with Halibut. It was so thick I had to chew it for long time. Halibut is supposed to be very thin and melt in your mouth. It's also supposed to be served with citrus ponzu, but didn't. So I asked for it. They gave me garlic ponzu, the same sauce they had on albacore. Not the same. True ponzu sauce does not contain garlic. Dragon roll was last. I was wondering what made this roll $14.00. There were so much eel on it, I had to separate eel from actual roll and eat it separately.  Another sushi place that think bigger is better. No knowledge of art of sushi.   The whole time we were there, sushi chef said 1 word. "How is everything?" after we ate everything. Sushi chefs kept disappearing after he made our order. I sat at sushi bar to interact. But they kept going to waitress station and talking to themselves. Loud enough for me to know they all spoke Korean to each other. The 2 ladies sitting next to us didn't help the matter either as they were laughing so hard it sounded almost screaming. We were still hungry, but we did not feel welcome there, so we just left.   I tried it because they had such great reviews. My experience was not as good as other reviewers here.

Great place to eat. Love the environment. Always busy and live inside . Weather it's to grab a quick bite to eat for lunch to go  or a date night , I would recommend this local spot. Convenient nice location.  Food is great and fresh. People are very attentive and kind. Ordered baked scallops with onion and mushrooms on a california roll And hubby ordered crazy boy roll and a few others . Highly recommend these 2 . They were delish.

For 20 years I have said I hated sushi, but my hairdresser just turned me onto this place and OMG!  I love sushi now! Between 3-5 pm is Happy Hour, and the Hostess had the good sense to give me that menu when I showed up a couple minutes past 5 by myself.  So, figuring the portions would be small, I ordered the Crispy Calamari and the Teriyaki Tuna Roll or close to that name.  Two words:  deeeeee-lisious!   And were the portions small?  Not by a long shot.  I ate what I ordered and waddled home...OMG!  It was filling. I totally take back everything I have said about Japanese food for years.  It can be delicious if made right, and this place definitely makes it right. This place is a real winner!  Will I go back?  You can bet on that one.
My boyfriend and I have given this place three chances but each time has been terrible service. The waitresses are straight up awful. Food was good.. but waitresses = garbage. Will never come back.

This review is for the 3-5p happy hour:  Ehhhhhh.....  Maybe I'm a sushi snob, but what I do know is that deep-fried does not equal sushi. There were 6 "sushi rolls" to choose from their happy hour menu, ALL of which consisted of deep-fried shiet. I don't get it? The sushi chefs are Japanese, they should be legit. The crunch roll was absolutely miniscule, the spicy tempura tuna roll and the tempura shrimp roll both had the same sugary mayo sauce squirted all over them, the green tea ice cream was covered in chocolate sauce!   Disappointed after all these great Yelp reviews. Come to the happy hour if you want to get drunk. The rolls aren't even that cheap for what you get. Meh.
Only mediocre. Definitely won't be back, they did have a friendly staff and the service was good though.
A++, my favorite sushi place in the world. Amazing atmosphere, attentive staff and best of all...fresh sushi dishes. Thank you Yen.

I go here for one thing and one thing only.  Lunch bento box with Korean BBQ ribs, California roll or spicy tuna roll, served with tempura, salad, rice and miso soup.  It really is a nice option for a bento box.  These BBQ ribs are simply amazing, so tasty that it will make you lick your fingers clean afterwards.  Their sushi isn't too bad either, especially during happy hour.  Small restaurant with nice Asian decor inside; has a sushi bar with flat screen TV; friendly service.  5 stars for the bento box with Korean BBQ ribs. 3-4 stars for other items.

If you go here, go there during happy hour, which ends at 5pm (not sure when it starts). They have a nice selection of rolls and appetizers which is nice.  If you are looking to be served like you would in a western restaurant, think again. Remember that this is an Asian restaurant where they want to take care of you, yes, but they will not be nearly as personal as you would find, say, at a Carrabba's or Benihana's. They get your order, talk fast, and get to work.  The soda here is not by the tap, but by the can. After the second refill, you have to pay for another soda. Again, that is the asian style of doing the restaurant business.  The sushi really was ok, but the environment is what hurt it for me. This is not the place to have a nice, sweet date. The walls echo every sound and I was frustrated by some customers that didn't mind being quite loud in the restaurant. They really weren't being too considerate of the people around them and I have a feeling this is standard for this place. They do not attract the most professional customers, but customers that you mighty find in a place a step above subway.  The bar itself looked really nice, though. I will give it that.  The only reason for the two stars is simply because I was expecting a nice, comfortable place to have a date, and enjoy quality service. The food was good, but the overall experience of being there and trying to actually enjoy everything...well, it wasn't there for me.  I don't like leaving reviews like this, but that's that. I know this place would be perfect for others, though. It is good sushi and you can get it quick.

Like most gems in Phoenix, Yen sushi is cleverly hidden in a strip mall.  Don't be deceived by it's dark tinted windows.  The sushi is always fresh and the staff is generally responsive.  It gets pretty busy on Thursday - Saturday around 6:30 - 8:30, so be sure to arrive a bit early or be prepared for a wait.  Also, their happy hour is decent with rolls priced at less than $6 each.

This place is great. I stopped in for lunch and ordered a spicy tuna toll, shrimp tempura roll, and some salmon and tuna sashimi. All was excellent. The sashimi pieces are nice and thick. The service is the fastest for sushi that I have ever had.. and I sat at the sushi bar and watched them make the food so I know it was fresh.  Great service, atmosphere and food.  I can't wait to try more.

great food all around. presentation of the sushi also great. the fish is always fresh. been back to this place many time. and so far, this is one of the best sushi in town. the only catch is, this place is not cheap.  you can spend $50 easy for lunch on a couple of nigiri. one thing though, skip the udon.

I owe this place a review years ago! They have the best lunch special! $8.99 for salad, rice, tempura and a cut roll with your choice of protein (chicken, salmon, spicy pork or kalbi for a couple of bucks more)! Also, for the price, quality and amount of fish that you get for sashimi, it's unbeatable. I had one of the best yellowtail sashimi's here. If you're on the low carb diet then their rock n roll roll is one of the best cucumber wrapped rolls have tried. The owner is cool and the servers are really friendly and nice. Never had an issue with service. Their Happy hour is solid too!

This place is fan-freakin-tastic. It's a hole in the wall. Maybe 7 or 8 tables. But seriously, the food is so delicious! Omg... Where to start! The happy hour menu is seriously good, and they have this crispy rice roll that is so interesting. It's deep fried rice with spicy tuna on top. Yum-o. Shits about to get real though when I tell you about the one item I eat every time I go there. Heart-attack!!!! First thing I do when I eat this is try and not look like an idiot. They don't have forks at a sushi place, well they prolly do but I'm not going to be the only person to actually ask for one. But really? Two sticks to eat rice? How did those win out?! Secondly, I try not to cry because it's so good. Anywho, the reason I try not to look like and idiot is because the pieces they cut are giant! Three bites all rolled into one delicious piece of heaven. It's a tempura roll with jalapeño, cream cheese and other mouthwatering ingredients. So i see myself choking on this every time I go to yen..but the taste is so overwhelming awesome. Don't bite it in half either, I tried this once and the other half landed in my wasabi/soy sauce bowl and made a huge splash everywhere. But in all seriousness, please go there and try it and think of me when you do, because you will also try and eat this in one bite and visions of choking will also cross your thoughts. Chew and enjoy this amazing piece of deliciousness in the west valley.
Rolls and sushi were delicious. Nice waitstaff. Professional chefs. Would go back any day. Love it.
Food was good the only thing I was annoyed about was that they didn't have a wide enough selection of sushi and that the restroom was out of order.

YEN! This Place is very good. The Happy Hour Prices are Awesome and lots of sushi to chose from! happy hour starts at 8pm- get there early because yes there is always a long wait. The Rock and Roll is my fave. The place is always pack so i never complain about the the waiters not coming to us every 5-10min so be warned and be nice.
Excellent fresh food and great service/atmosphere. Their portions were big and I totally over-ordered but everything was so good. I would love to come back again and try everything they have!

I'm someone who does not like anything fishy, but I went bravely to Yen's for my first sushi experience upon recommendations from family & friends. They were right, it was great! The tempura calimari roll made me a fan. I went big & tried the raw trio and found I actually liked the tuna. There is a good deal was soup & a Cali or spicy tuna roll (or raw trio) plus choice of another roll for $8.99, and it was more than I could finish eating. Overall: good food, good price, good quantity.
They have in my opinion, the best sushi at the best prices, especially the lunch menu.  I probably go there at least three times a week! Service is excellent as well. Never disappoints.

I was looking through my recent check in's and realized that I never reviewed Zen Sushi?!? I've been here probably 10 times! Well I'm finally getting around to a review.   I love Zen. It's one of the best sushi restaurants in town. Their happy hour is excellent with $5 sushi rolls. Granted all of the rolls are deep fried but they are huge and taste great. A bonus is the $5 sake bombers too!  Reverse Happy hour starts at 8 and runs until close.   I also love the Rainbow roll and the yellowtail sashmi. Very fresh and tender. I usually order a combination of menu items as well as a few happy hour rolls. I totally recommend the calamari roll which includes several giant strips if fried calamari.   Service is also excellent at Yen. The other day we came in 10 mins before closing (we thought it closed at 10) and the staff still sat us and took our order without rushing us. Very nice and I honestly expected them to turn us away at the door.   If your in the NW area and are craving sushi come here. You will not be disappointed!

When it's sushi time (about once a week) this is our go to consistently fresh and good Sushi place.  If we are not experimenting with new places and want to stay close to home, we know we can depend on Yen!!!

This place was Awesome from the sushi itself to the friendly and prompt service. We tried the Sunset roll, rattlesnake as well as eel and tuna nigiri. All Amazing.  The Cosmo I ordered was good but not traditionally made. Seem like it had soju or sake in it. We finished with the chocolate caramel which was the chocolate mousse pyramid and it was great too. Must try this great sushi restaurant! Next time we plan to hit the happy hour time. 3-5pm or 8-close.

This place is in a strip mall.  It has an OK ambiance.  The Miso soup we ordered came to us Luke warm to cold, not good.  We ordered the salmon scallop roll which was not so good and the rattlesnake roll which was much better.  The service was OK, however the sushi chef kept having to flag down the server when the food was ready, kind of like the server just didn't care about us but rather the big screen TV with the football game on.  I don't think we will be going back, this is a good place but lacks the appeal for us.

It's a great place, We've tried a lot of sushi places (not by choice) and always end up coming right back here. The food is worth the 12 mile trip from our house alone but it is also in good portions and simply delightful tastes. It's never lacking in flavor or presentation. Sometimes the greeting service is a little slow, but we usually go during happy hour and they get quite busy, so understandable. But once you are seated, it is very quick and each server helps each other out so you can ask anyone for anything and they don't make you feel like you're bothering them. We prefer Jasmine, as she always has a smile and recognizes us right away. She makes comfortable small talk without being too much. But they are all very good. We really recommend this place to anyone just looking for a nice and enjoyable meal all around.

We were looking for a new sushi place after having a bad experience at our old local place, Kabuki.  So after 'Yelping' it, we found this place.  When walking in, it had the nice smell of.. a hair and nail salon.  Oddly there were none around.  Once walking in, you definitely got the nice aroma of sushi around you.  And No, not the fishy smell.    We sat and ordered the drinks.  heads up.. if you want soda, this place is not on fountain  yet, so get ready to pay $1.50 a can.  Glad I drank iced tea.   So my review is based on the food alone.  I had probably the best Rainbow Roll I have ever eaten.  It was so good.. that after I was done, i ordered another one.    I usually get the edemame, but there's wasnt that great.  It wasnt bad, it just didint 'wow' me.    Would I go here again? Definitely.   This place is really packed.. which is so odd because it's not in a great location.  Good food I guess! :)
First time here. Very reasonable and fresh. Crispy rice spicy tuna and garlic albacore roll fantastic.

Happy hour is great for drinks, but could stand to be expanded a bit on the food side.  With that said, the food itself is delicious and very reasonably priced even outside of happy hour. I'd recommend the spicy tuna salad - delicious and a great value for how much you get.

I used to live right around the corner of this place.  I would say lunch specials are really good. Everyone is very friendly here. Dinner rolls are somewhat expensive. But definitely recommend people to come here.
Mediocre sushi with higher end prices than you should find at a local sushi plac.

I write this review with sadness, as this was my go-to sushi restaurant over the last two years.    SUMMARY:   Long delays, delievered wrong order, mediocre food, billed for the wrong order, more delays waiting to correct my bill.    DETAILS:   The wait staff was not knowledgable and were not attentive. The food (curry udon and salmon teriyaki) was OK at best, but then we had massive waits in order to be served.  After a very long wait the food arrived, bringing the wrong plate which was then sent back.   We then waited....and waited...and waited some more.   As we finished our lunch, I gave my credit card prior to the bill as I (correctly) anticipated further delays.  They charged me for the other salmon dish that they brought by mistake, and I then had to wait another :10 for them to credit my card and get my correct bill.  I can't take :90 lunches especially with poor service and mediocre sushi.

We decided to sit outside since it was soooo loud inside, the waitresses (plural) were so rude...we asked for extra glass of water...rude again...and said since we decided to sit outside we would not get proper service...we had a couple seated at the same time, they left the restaurant before we were served water..!!!...they served our food finally and almost threw it on the table...checked on us once...Their was not a smile out of either two of the waitresses...if you have tables outside, are they not for eating..???...but we left a $6.00 tip...we will not be back...
Great happy hour menu. We love coming here for reverse happy hour. Very affordable great atmosphere friendly service excellent sushi
Wonderful neighborhood sushi spot. Whenever I'm in the area I always come by.  You can't beat their happy hour prices that run the majority of the day.

This place was a huge disappointment. First of all almost all the rolls here are super Americanized. There is a crunchy rice roll on the happy hour menu and I suggest you stay away from it. My friend and I both got sick after eating here and it was some of the worst selection of sushi rolls I have seen in a long time. Almost everything is baked or fried. Very few fresh sushi roll options.
Absolutely wonderful, fresh and carefully prepared sushi at this restaurant. The service is polite, quick and professional. Great place for sushi!

This place has gotten really good reviews so I had to put this restaurant on my short list of places to check out.  I have come here twice in the past week, first was for a late lunch, and the second time was dinner with friends.  Both times were great, I love the feel here.  Feels like an authenic sushi restaurant, not that I know what that means, just doesn't feel like a glamarous overated place like you'd see in Scottsdale.  The employees fit the title, inside is decorated appropiately and oh that sushi comes out fresh, tasty, and with style.   This is my favorite place so far in AZ, I will be back again in no time.
This is by far my favorite sushi joint! The food is always fresh and delicious! Hot night roll is my favorite. Happy hour has great deals!

I'm updating my review to 4 out of 5.   I'm docking off 1 star because the sushi isn't great here. Sad, but true. The quality of the fish isn't to my standards for a restaurant to have the word 'sushi' in its name. It's edible, but not good quality. The uni (sea urchin) is probably the only thing that's legit. HOWEVER, they aren't stingy on how much they give. Nice decent thickness to their fish, piled on uni on the uni sushi, etc.  Their cooked foods are pretty darn good!! BIG FAN of the lunch menu.... esp. the BBQ ribs. It's soo tasty and only around $8-9 during lunch! It comes with two vegetable tempura and dip, 4 pieces of sushi roll (I picked spicy tuna, but you can choose California roll), salad, a little rice, BBQ ribs, and miso soup.  Great deal for this tasty dish!   I will be back.

I feel so bad cheating on my beloved Tokyo Lobby, but Yen is pretty darn good.   Definitely go during happy hour. Their rolls and appetizers are only 5 dollars each.   We ordered the calamari roll, shrimp tempura, spicy tuna on top of crispy rice and crazy boy roll. They were all fabulous!   They also brought us complimentary miso soup.   We arrived at 7:45pm and the place was dead. By the time happy hour started at 8:00pm, the place started to fill up. By the time we left, around 8:45pm, the place was packed!   The only thing I would say is, they need more servers. We had to flag someone down to refill our waters and take our check several times.   Other than that, everything was great!

I absolutely love this sushi bar. Best you can find in the area for the price. Very small location but never too busy or crowded. Their happy hour is amazing, great prices and even better selection! Haven't found something me or my friends haven't liked yet. Service is ALWAYS quick and friendly. Will be back!

OMG THIS IS MY 500th REVIEW!  HOLY COW I CAN"T BELIEVE I MADE IT THIS FAR! Plus, it was my birthday on Tuesday the 12th, which makes it an even BETTER week!  But, here's how our Friday afternoon happy celebration went:  So a bunch of us girls decided to do happy hour after work today, and one of my coworkers suggested this place. I don't eat sushi often, and usually need help ordering since I have no clue what I'm doing!  Upon entering, I really liked how the place was set up. Cute tables, with a great Asian flare.  Not flashy, but not understated either. My friends helped me order off the happy hour menu, and the food was delicious! I went with a deep fried california roll, along with another dish that I split with my friend. I can't remember the name of it, but I do know it had pink fish on top with white rice underneath.  The service was a bit slow at first, but eventually got better as the night went on. We were getting antsy to order, and kept waiting, and waiting, and waiting some more. Eventually the service picked up, but it took a little bit. We had a big table and there were lots of mouths to feed, so it was evened out in the end.  Overall, I was happy with eating here.  Plenty of food, great menu, and amazing happy hour prices.  Place was packed, so get there early so you can get a seat and get your grub on from 3-5.

Many times came to this sushi place when visiting Arizona for business.  Normaly order a dragon roll which comes with whole piece of eel on top. This time a little disapointed because of the eel sauce on top.  Besides the eel sauce that made a roll taste a little weird and sweet everything is good.

my friends and I went here for the first time last night and we were VERY happy! Their happy hour menu is fantastic! we got the philly roll, crazy boy, spicy tuna tempura, and shrimp tempura. They were all really delicious and had sooo much flavor. This place blew RA out of the water.  the location is eh, but the sushi is FAB!   the staff was really nice. I asked for extra ginger and boy, they weren't stingy at all! Oh and their prices are great!  Thank goodness we found this place because I'm a fan and will be back. NO MORE KOI for meeeeee :) YAYERRR!!!

Came here for dinner while traveling on business; I like to check out local sushi places where I go, and this one had pretty good reviews.   I would give this place 2.5 stars, if Yelp allowed half-stars, but I decided to round down, rather than up, because nothing really impressed me about this place. I ordered a big Kirin Ichiban beer, seaweed salad, small sashimi combo platter, and green tea mochi ice cream.  Turned out to be a big meal for one person.  The seaweed salad was much bigger than most places serve, which confused me, as I didn't want to fill up on seaweed.  It was $8.00, and had a sliver of crab on top of it.  Weird.  The sashimi was rather good; the small platter had 5 pieces each of octopus, albacore, fatty tuna, yellowfin, and salmon.  This is more sashimi than a typical small combo, and the price tag was higher, too ($28.00).  The individual sashimi orders on the menu were 7-8 pieces each, and most were $10.95.  What irked me was the albacore.  It had been seared in a previous life, with some weird spices, then chilled, giving it a hard outer crust and limp interior.  It reminded me of lunchmeat.  Not good. Not many sushi places offer the mochi ice cream - I was happy to see they had 'em.   Overall, decent quality fish, prices are rather high, chefs are pleasant...better than many sushi places in Phoenix.  I'm still searching for the sushi Mecca in that area, though.

This is my new favorite sushi spot for lunch. I sit at the sushi bar, and Paul, the chef is friendly and obviously has a great memory (Or....I eat there way too often!).  I don't even need to order anymore. I walk in, they bring me the large starter salad (the delicious ginger dressing is my new fav). Then comes the Rock and Roll riceless roll with extra ginger. I've been there twice when the sushi chefs bring out huge fish, and filet it into sashimi pieces right in front of you. I was fascinated! I kept taking photos of him throughout the process, which he thought was hilarious. I definitely recommend this place - fresh and great happy hour drinks and food!

Yen is the best, don't bother eating sushi elsewhere. I've tried, and nothing compares to yen. The staff here are friendly and the food is wonderful, what more could you want!  My husband is a professional deep sea fisherman and before that a crabber. So I would say he knows a thing or two about good fresh fish. I took him here dragging his feet because he doesn't like eating sea food anywhere that's not coastal. He was impressed. Actually the words that came out of his mouth were "this is some of the best crab I've ever had". To eat some of the best crab one has ever had when you've had ALOT says something. This place is definitely worth a try if you haven't already. Make sure you get here in off hours before lunch or dinner because it is a very small restaurant.

I appreciate the great service. Excellent Sushi Chiefs, and quality of product. I have been coming to this fantastic establishment for a long time and have brought many new customers along with me and they are loyal followers of the YEN!!  Don't take my word for it try it. Sushi when appreciated for the complex flavors and how quality product make all the difference here is your place.
Service was good. Food came out on a timely manner. Price is reasonable. No complain here.

I have been getting sushi from yen for years, however the service continues to lack basic skills in being attentive and polite to the customers. It is surprising that even with servers changing over time that the customer service still fails in my opinion. The sushi on the other hand is good and fresh.
Enjoyed it so much yesterday had to bring my gal back. Some Miso Soup, another helping of the Rainbow Roll (selected fish) fished by Baked Lobster Tail Special Roll! Absolutely fantastic!

I am from CA and have good sushi available at my fingertips. I visit AZ once a month and like to try different/new sushi spots in the Phoenix area. I will say that THIS IS THE BEST sushi I have had in AZ and thee only place that I will return. I have to agree with others that the happy hour prices for drinks were amazing. The rolls were fresh and well made: Rainbow Roll, Crazy Boy Roll, Phoenix Roll, Rattlesnake, Salmon Tempura Roll. I was so happy and pleased on the fresh cool taste of the phoenix roll. The Rattlesnake was GREAT. I love a eel and ell sauce. It was like home eating a Dragon or Caterpillar Roll. I will be back with a bigger stomach wanting to try these rolls again or new ones.

I haven't been here for a quite while but I tried again yesterday. I think their $5 happy hour is a pretty good deal. We went after 8pm and I think they have happy hour from 8 to close. (They have 2 happy hours but I'm not sure about the other one). I like all the rolls they have and for $5 you can't beat it.

Great!!!  Been here many times.  Sushi is great, as is the lovely iced tea...green or regular.  They made it bigger ( well, not in that way), and can fit many more people.  Owner and cute girls that work there are very nice.    Sushi great, nice deal, but gets busy.  All in all, very tasty and fresh sushi.  I find the vegetable gyoza simply divine.  I would go so far as to say, this is the best sushi on the West side of town.  No pretentious sushi gimmicks, just great sushi at a reasonable price.   "Sometimes, it ok to pay full price and less busy." Confucius, 570 BC

We've been coming to Yen for years. We've tried numerous sushi restaurants and nothing holds a candle to Yen. I swear they have a magical avocado tree in the back because they are so creamy and delicious!! Yen's consistency is on point. We've literally never, not once, had a bad experience there. The staff is great and the sushi chefs are always making everyone feel welcome the second they walk in the door. They've got gluten free soy sauce as well so that's a major plus for me! I can't imagine finding anywhere better than Yen for sushi.

We eat here at least once a week.  Easily the best and freshest sushi in Arizona, California and Mexico.  Paul is a master at selecting fish.  His sauces are awesome and very flavorful. Shashimi - please Rolls - yep Sushi - yes yes yes Happy Hour - worth it Green Ice Tea - their own blend.  Good for what ails you.

I think I've found one of the best sushi spots in the West Valley. The fish was fresh, the service impeccable, lots of choices. I absolutely LOVED this place and so did my guest. Yen Sushi will be my go to sushi spot when I venture out west...Wish they'd open a spot in the East...

Yen Sushi was my first sushi experience and I was amazed. I started coming here about three years ago with my boyfriend and the place has been getting better and bigger. It is amazing seeing a small business expand and get even busier. Their happy hour prices are great and the food is always amazing. My favorite is the crazy boy roll. The customer service is very attentive and I have had a wonderful experience each time that I go.

The staff here themselves make Yen such a great place to eat!  For saucy, mixture of fix in's in your sushi type of rolls, this is the place. Got two rolls here to share- Caterpillar and Unagi (I believe) and Shrimp Tempura.  The caterpillar rolls was good, fresh avocado and almost melt in your mouth. It was that good. The unagi was good, flavorful, fresh and moist, though it had too much sauce at some points.  The service was great. Loved seeing the sushi chefs at work, the server helping us- who spoke Korean was such a delight and probably the happiest waiter I've ever came across! I was a waitress before and I don't think I had that much energy- ever.   I need to come back to check out their sashimi and nigiri because the pics look amazing!
This place is so amazing. They have spectacular lunch specials, but the food is to die for any time of the day. The people are friendly and the service is on pointe.

I decided to try this place because of the reviews here on yelp. It has a nice set up. The happy hour specials are great. The sushi had good flavor. The dipping sauce for the tempura was spot on. Sakebombers, awesome. They even had a cool twist on the green tea ice cream. The only downfall was that my waitress could have been a little more attentive.

I don't know what the other reviewers are all happy about. Went with my girlfriend to this place based on the reviews. The sushi is mediocre at best. The chief special, don'tcry roll, was a joke. It was horribly put together and my girlfriend who can eat sushi everyday, wouldn't finish it. The service was rushed and barely there. We asked for saratcha and never received it. The only reason I am giving two stars is because their watermelon cocktail was very good. Everything else was mediocre, and for spending a hundred dollars on sushi, I expect better. We will stick with Kabuki.

Prices increased. Quality drastically decreased.   The rolls are half of what they used to be. You need to remind the servers a few times to bring your drink refills, sauces.   Edema arrived after sushi.  Servers need to smile. Sadly, Yen is not what it used to be.

Casual and comfortable, Yen isn't a see-and-be-seen place, but it sure hits the spot when you're craving some sushi. And for the record, it does have quite a bit more ambiance (read low lighting, muted decor, and pillowed benches) than several other places of its size and relative location.  Let's get to the important stuff: the food. I've been here a few times and never had anything less than fresh, quality fish. Toro, Sake, Hamachi, we've had it sashimi style and in funky-good rolls. Unagi and Tuna tataki are top notch, too. Among my favorites are the Sunset Roll (crab mix and avocado roll topped with salmon, sliced lemon, and rooster sauce), and the heart attack (think jalapeno poppers stuffed with seafood).  They have great happy hour discounts on drinks and food, but for me the hh menu is a little one-dimensional with mostly tempura items. I love me a deal, but I would suggest mixing in a few regular menu items to round out the experience.  Oh, and don't dine here if you're in a time crunch. The service has always been courteous, friendly - and beyond slow. I usually enjoy a slower pace, but it's nice to have a full water glass and a drinky-poo to help pass the time.
Amazing sushi always fresh- whenever we try a new spot my husband and I always say- "why didn't we go to Yen?"

This place is located next door to a nail salon.  The smell is overwhelming.  The acetone and other strong chemicals used at that salon carry over into the restuarant.  I am sorry for them.  We were there 8/15/11 for happy hour.  Food was average.  Service was average.  All just average.  I think others give this place high stars because they have no other sushi options in this area.  They don't know what they are missing.  There is nothing special about Yen.  And the chemical smell from their neighbor was so strong that we will never go there again.  I don't know who was there first, but if Yen wants to stay, I hope the nail place relocates.

Yen is by far in my top 3 sushi bars. The staff are always friendly and chef Paul makes some tasty rolls. Happy hour rolls are a bit limited (I hope they add more), but they are delicious. My favorite is their Philly roll. Most places put cucumber or carrot, but Yen uses asparagus instead and wow what a difference. The calamari roll is very good (texture is not rubbery like other places I've been too *cough* Kabuki). If you want a roll without rice I recommend the rock and roll. This roll has salmon/tuna/avocado wrapped in cucumber. The chef uses skewers to hold them in place which makes for an interesting plating. This is a great little place and with amazing quality sushi.

We had never heard of Yen Sushi before some family members took us here for happy hour one evening.  Wow, what a hidden gem we were missing out on!    We probably ordered enough food for 10 people... and the 4 of us ate it all. It was all amazing. The presentation of the food really stood out to me. The Calamari Roll (my absolute favorite) even comes with a few fried calamari on the side! What a deal!   Inside it feels cozy and welcoming, and the staff was all extremely friendly.  I have a feeling Yen Sushi is going to become a regular place for us!

Its pretty rare to find a decent sushi restaurant in phoenix that stays consistent with their quality of food and customer service.  This is a restaurant that stays true to their customers and really pride on their customer service.   Highly recommend everyone to get a true taste of how a sushi restaurant should be.  Rock & Roll roll is a must to try!

Amazing is all I can say. We started with happy hour. 5$ saki bombs and 5$ sushi rolls. We tried the tempura salmon roll and the Philadelphia. Both were spectacular. My entrée was the salmon plate. At 14$ it was worth every penny. I was given two huge pieces of salmon that was seared in teriyaki.   This is by far the best sushi place I have ever been to. And could u imagine it's in the middle of the desert??  Just amazing. I can't wait to come back and stuff my face again at this place.   Make sure you come during happy hour to get the great deals on the best sushi and drinks.

Fantastic food as a good price! I have been here a few times now and I am fan of both their sushi and bento box lunch menus! Sushi is very fresh and flavorful (unlike other places where it all tastes the same, each roll is very unique). In addition, if you are looking for a quick lunch, stop by before 3 PM and have a lunch combo which is fantastic. In most cases there was only one server but she was very prompt with refills, soups and making her presence known (which brings to questions why other waiters/waitresses have problems managing 2 or 3 tables!) Will be coming back very shortly!

Friends and I were craving for udon / Ramen and decided to eat out.  We had just bailed out of a different restaurant because of a near death experience and we are happy to have found this place.   Good amount of lighting, well decorated, quite clean, the staff was super polite and nice, and the place smelled well.   We were promptly seated and our drinks were ordered immediately.  We each ordered the Nabeyaki Udon which was pretty good.  Mines was a little salty, but it's okay, I didn't die.  We also order a few rolls along with it.    Great place, I believe we will come back in the near future.
Best time to go is during happy hour when Paul, the owner, is working. If you like sushi, this place is a must try. It's hard to find decent sushi in Arizona, and Yen is one of the better ones.

Best sushi you will find in AZ. I have been coming here for years. They are a little pricey, but if you go during happy hour they have delicious rolls for $5. My daughter was hooked on sushi at age 5 because of Yen.  Can't stop, won't stop, they will always be my fave.

Not very impressed as it had 4 stars. Service wasn't the greatest. Food was mediocre. Took a long time just to get situated with the orders. I order the spicy tuna tempura roll which was ok, wish it had more spicy mayo on it as it was a bit dry. Not a place I would rave about returning again.

We love this place!  My husband turned me on to Sushi and I am still exploring lots of options but this place is by far the best we've found in the Valley.    It can get very crowded and quiet noisy.  We avoid Friday and Saturday nights after 8:00pm when their happy hour kicks in again. The noise level makes it difficult to have a conversation.     We did have one experience that could have been handled better but you can NOT beat the sushi.  I would certainly suggest you try it.
Yen sets the bar for any other sushi restaurant in the valley! Always the freshest fish, superior service, affordable prices, and casual atmosphere. I absolutely love this place!

Pros: - the sweet water eel Chirashi was a true delicacy. The eel was very fresh and impeccably prepared with just the right amount of sauce. - 911 rolls were OK - impeccable service  Cons: - weird mall location, somewhat hidden/hard to find
The sushi here is amazing. Tried the salmon skin salad for the first time. That was incredible... Of you want to just eat something light and just drink, then this is the dish.
It is a nice place to have some sushi , but really overpriced . And service is not the best or fast . Been there a few times would rather go somewhere els.

We love this place! We eat here at least twice a month! The food is great as is the service. The sashimi is fresh and cold and the beer is ice cold! Nice atmosphere too! This is in a strip mall and it is easy to miss. It does not look like much from the outside but you are pleasantly surprised when you enter the doors. After reading some of the other reviews,  I think the trick to the service being good or poor is when you go. We never go during happy hour. It is not busy when we are there, therefore we have good service.
Great sushi, friendly staff, and amazing mochi ice cream! They also have a really great happy hour menu!
We went back the second time around it was just as good as the first. We had the stuffed jalapeño and some other sushi haut wanted to share some pics.

I solely picked this place because of the reviews it had and close to our house. The moment we walked in we were greeted, sat down and given our first drink. All within minutes. Both my girlfriend and I had great service overall and prices were reasonable. Quiet and lovely ambience which made it not like any typical franchise sushi place. Will be back again as we were overall happy with the service, price and food!

We go there for date night and ask to sit outside. They take our ID away to make sure we "don't dash and run". That's classy!!! Then we order a roll at full price, not at happy hour, and I ask to remove the mayo because of my dairy allergy and the waitress says she will charge me $2 more to put crab sticks (whatever that is) instead of mixed crab with mayo. So I said just remove it and sub with salmon which was in the roll as a second ingredient. She said "no we don't do substitutions. We can replace with cucumbers ". I'm sorry but that is the worst service ever. It's not the $2, it's the principle. Never going there again! And the servings our tiny. We got the tuna roll and for $6 it was so small it could fit up my nostril!

I will start by saying I love Yen. We have a standing Friday afternoon tradition of heading to Yen during their afternoon happy hour (3-5) and throwing down as much $5 rolls and Sake as we can in the time we have.  They have a happy hour menu that contains maybe 10-15  $5 items including the kids favorite Crazy Boy Roll. The menu has something for everyone and the $3 large Sake is a nice touch too.   I have had lots of mediocre Sushi in Phoenix and some way over priced decent sushi and yen is good sushi for a reasonable price.

Terrific sushi restaurant! Went on a Friday night and there was a late night happy hour from 8-close. The happy hour menu is quite extensive; there were probably over 30 rolls on the HH menu. I'm not s big seafood person at all so I basically got two variations of the California roll: the Craze Boy Roll and the Chili Crab Roll. Both were on point! Nice consistency, flavor and freshness.   The service was friendly and the food was prepared fast. Overall, a very good sushi option with great HH specials.

Good God, where has this been hiding? My bf and I just made our periodic trip to Phoenix and discovered this little gem. From his kids, no less.   We went during the 8pm-10pm Happy Hour...on a Friday night. We got a table in about 20 minutes for 6 of us. Our server was super friendly and took our drink order right away. The cosmos and appletinis were $4 and the sake bombs (with Kirin or Sapporo) were $5 and numerous rolls were $5 each; how do you beat that?   The food was spectacular. We ordered off of the regular menu (2 orders or tuna tataki, 2 orders of heart attacks, and a dragon roll) and the happy hour menu (crispy spicy tuna, philadelphia roll, calamari roll, shrimp tempura roll and a couple of others that I can't seem to remember). OMG, one slice of that tuna tataki and I was SOLD. This was some seriously great sushi...Bravo Yen Sushi!   Our bill for 6 peeps was $96, that's with the tip included, no less...YAY! I will definitely be back.

YEN whoops all other PHX sushi bars boo-tays.  Big time.   Heres why:  Freshest fish Unassuming, genuinely nice chefs and staff amazing prices huge selection fast..very fast. Especially since I recently fell out of love with Yasu when I placed a to-go order that they quoted me 30 minutes on and then when I arrived, they told me it would be another hour. (BOO on them, and yes I am still bitter) Thank god my search for a better place is over! No more of them acting like they are doing me a favor by waiting on me!! They also dont act like you are crazy when you roll up in there on a whim wanting a few rolls...  GO YEN! YOU ROCK!

Yum, Yum, Yum!  I am a huge sushi fan and eat some type of sushi every week! I really enjoyed my experience and would recommend this place to any sushi lover. There is a large selection of fish and rolls and the prices were not jumping off of the menu. The fish is very fresh and quite frankly, when its 115 degrees outside and 1,000 miles from the nearest ocean, the quality and freshness was great!

Best sushi in town hands down if I'm craving sushi this place is the place to go try there sunset roll very good if you like salmon fish is always fresh customer service is good just in general this place is a gem

Went today with a friend and we had a great lunch.  We started with the edamame and ordered 3 rolls.  The first to arrive was the shrimp and soy paper roll.  It was very good it had big pieces of shrimp with some crab and asparagus in it.  They topped it with a creamy sauce that made me not even use my soy sauce for dipping.  We then got the our next two rolls which were the heart attack roll and the shrimp tempura roll.  They were both very good and again covered in a sauce that tasted great with the roll.  We both left very happy and full.
Absolutely love this place! My husband and I come as often as we can and we're never disappointed. We also did our wedding dinner here, and the accommodations were amazing!

I tried several different rolls between my boyfriend and I. Sushi was good and it felt safe which is always in the back of my mind when consuming something raw from the ocean...in the middle of the desert.  The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because the staff would not let my boyfriend and I look over the menu in peace. We had 3 different people ask us multiple times each if we were ready to order. I understand you want to be attentive, but you have a lot of choices and I'm trying to decide what will be the best for me :)  I will be back and try to be less annoyed about attentive customer service lol.  Side Note: its freezing in here so bring a sweater. Accept the chilly temperature by picturing yourself eating raw fish in a muggy little restaurant. Gross.

This place is pretty good, my party went there for happy hour. I had friendly service and reasonable beverage pricing. The major disappointment was that they have mostly tempura (fried) sushi on the happy hour menu. Only one item wasn't fried (Philadelphia roll). Won't go back unless they change this up.

As good as it gets in the Valley. Has to be the best and freshest sushi I have had here. Three of us went in after 9pm on a Friday night. The best part about rolling in late was the reverse happy hour. Nice list of rolls, appetizers and beverages at happy hour prices.  We picked up an app and a couple rolls off the menu. We also ordered a small sashimi sampler and a plate of yellow fin tataki with chile. I am still daydreaming about the freshness and the clean flavors of the sashimi and tataki.   The restaurant is in a shopping center but it offered ample parking. The place was packed when we arrived but we didn't wait long to get a table (about 5 minutes).

I was here for the first time yesterday with a friend for lunch.  What a great place!  Wonderful food and so affordable.  This is better than some of the higher priced places, I've been to.  The ambiance is perfect for a date night or just a quiet time with friends noshing on your favorite sushi.  Fabulous wait staff and such a clean and tidy place!   Quaint, cozy, hidden away,  Just a neat spot fir great sushi.  I'll definitely be back!
This is an awesome place to go for great fresh sushi and Japanese cuisine. Small place but great atmosphere and friendly service.

3.5-4 stars depending on the night you go!  Love this place because of the happy hour, they have an evening one and a late-night one. I started coming here 2 years ago when I first moved to AZ and being a California native, this was the ONLY place in Glendale that came close to California quality sushi. Yen was my go to sushi spot until Sushi Catcher opened up right by my apartment and replaced it as my favorite sushi place in the area... Its ok! I'll be back! I like the different fusion sushi rolls here (Hawaiian roll, sunset roll, spicy tuna tempura roll, lobster roll, yellow tail scallion) but the sashimi is hit or miss, you really can taste a difference depending on which day of the week you go. The have good drink specials with sake, and their green tea tempura icecream is delish.   Its a fairly small restaurant and service is quick and efficient. A little on the pricier side but its worth the price.
Good place to get drunk during the happy hour.  Happy hour rolls are deep fried.  Run down bathroom.  Just not what I was expecting from such a highly rated place.

Well, I'm going to make it official: I like this place.   Food wise, I'm always on-board for the Nabeyaki Udon, and have been especially enjoying it on chilly days as of late. (only way it could be better is: two tempura shrimp instead of one and that the shrimp is served on the side so it doesn't have a chance to get soggy. Request it as such!)   Hub likes a double by-pass (i.e. TWO heart attack rolls) and though deep-fried sushi isn't so much my thing, I agree that this item is delicious. And, just a note, most happy hour selections have a deep-fried component. Drink specials on happy hour are decent as well. (Like $3 for large sake.)   All the maki / sushi we've tried here has been fresh and tasty and a reasonable value. There are other menu choices like katsu chicken that have done the trick as well.   The service is always delightful.   At first, I didn't care for the layout of the place but the ambiance, food and service (plus a recent table by the window, even though it's just a parking lot view) have done wonders to dispel any hesitation about dining here regularly.

One of the better sushi happy hours I have ever seen.  It's not the biggest place so make sure you get here a bit early to get a good table.  All the happy hour items we had were delicious.  Service was adequate.
Love this place, we have been twice in the last week and will be headed there today.  Sushi taste fresh and ohhh so yummy.  Love the sunset roll.

Took my sister out for her first time having sushi. The sashimi combo was delicious. 5 pieces of 5 types of sushi and 2 bottles of hot house sake. We loved it! Very helpful and friendly staff. Excellent experience! I will definitely be coming back.

I don't usually write reviews very often (in fact ever).  But I felt that the 4.5 stars does not currently reflect my previous sushi experience here.    First off, the service here was really good.  The waitress was really nice, very prompt and courteous and provided the food quickly.   The food itself, was prepared well, I usually eat a lot of nigiri and the pieces are ok in amount of fish, the rice was packed well and the quality of the fish was good.  The major downside in my opinion is that its pricier than I expected.  I wish Yelp would provide "2.5 dollar signs".  Granted, I did not come for "Happy Hour" which ends relatively early at 5pm.  I go to a lot of sushi restaurants and for the amount of fish provided, I would have expected it to be cheaper.  Also, the edamame cost $$.  Even the miso soup is not complimentary.  Considering the above average price, I've been to too many other places that have the same price, same quality, and provided the necessities for free.  Oh, I even forgot that a bowl of white rice for my child was even a charge.    So, the nickel and dime of things I would have expected compounded with the surprisingly above average price, I can only say that Yen Sushi was "ok".  The other two people in my party (minus the children) also agree.
Sushi is actually really good.  Service is terrible especially the hostess.  Unwilling to accommodate any party over 4 on two separate occasions.

has anyone else played Diner Dash?  i had the music and images of my finger dragging customers to tables, taking orders, and delivering food. two waitresses and servers for a restaurant of 10-12 tables and a handful of sushi bar spots. for some tables -- like ours --i could see the smoke coming out of our ears as we were waiting to order!   but i digress.  for phoenix, four stars. lumped into sushi restaurants as a whole, 3 stars.   excellent value for money (45 piece sashimi platter for $45 is your best bet) and mostly fresh fish. some cuts of fish were better than others, but in general, i did have to drown them in wasabi to cut the taste of fishi-ness. you will be spoiled for choice with the sushi roll menu, and their servings are generous. nothing super memorable.   i might go back if i had a super sushi craving.

Thank god we finally found a good sushi place in Phoenix.  I thought it would never happen.  We had the Heart Attack, the Calamari Tempura Roll, The Rattlesnake, Soft Shell Crab, and a couple of Kirin.  OK.  The Heart Attack is amazing.  I mean, seriously.  It's like everything that is good about Jalapeno Poppers and everything that is good about a good roll all mixed up into one.  While the Calamari Tempura and the Soft Shell Crab Rolls were good - they always are - the Rattlesnake was the best.  I have a secret love for Freshwater Eel, but this roll capitalized on it and it was tremendous.    I do kinda wish we had gotten there before 5 or after 8 so we had been able to take advantage of Happy Hour - every day from 3-5 and 8-close (cuz they have $5 rolls and drinks!) but, even though we spent more than we wanted, it was well worth it.    I will DEFINITELY be going back.
Loved it.  Great atmosphere, similar to Yasu in that regard.  Great sushi and lots of great rolls.  Fun spot.

We frequent this restaurant often, the sushi is fresh and they have a great happy hour menu. Just know it is very popular at happy hour but it's worth the wait. Great atmosphere low lights and very relaxing.

Been here twice now- once for dinner and once for lunch. Service is fast and the food terrific. A decent amount of selection on the sushi rolls but the only criticism I have is that the printed menu doesn't quite match up with the paper sushi ordering menu so you have to do a lot of hunting to get descriptions of the food.   The place is very popular- get there early if you want a seat.   The fish is very fresh and I was impressed by the quality of the food. Our new north side favorite place.
Our first time here. We had very prompt and polite service. Had the baked lobster roll, which was very good.  It's a quiet atmosphere, good to bring the wife!
I am a picky sushi fanatic- this place is the real deal - you will never know it from the outside but once you enter the rising sun will greet you with amazing Sushi

Are those chopsticks in your pocket or are you just happy to sashimi?  Nabeyaki Udon! What a treat!  Any place that can offer me a raw egg yolk is a winner in my eyes.  There were a lot of flavors and texture in this bowl.  My tempura shrimp actually ended up submerged in the broth and got soggy so that wasn't as fun.  I'll be sure to ask for it on the side next time.  I love enoki mushrooms in my hot pot so it was definitely loved in my bowl of udon.  The broth was on the salter side for my taste but it wasn't to the point where I couldn't enjoy my meal.  The udon itself was just okay. I had just gotten back in town from a place that makes their udon fresh and in-house though so it was gonna be hard to please the taste buds after that!  This place makes a solid bowl of noodles and what a great Happy Hour menu offering.  The rolls I did try were pretty tasty.  The atmosphere is fun and casual.  All my friends seemed to enjoy their dinner as well so I'd say this place was great!  I'm glad I saw Kazi H.'s review!
Went there last night ordered sushi best sushi in town specially the Las Vegas roll would definitely recommend friends

What a great sushi place in Glendale!  This will now be on my top five list for sushi.  Great choices of sushi rolls on the menu and a great place to hang out with friends or a date.  Will certainly be back!
This is a great sushi place, it looks like they opened the restaurant some more so there is more space. Nice atmosphere, its around the corner from me so Im sure I will stop in again.
Outstanding service and delicious sushi! Sashimi was super fresh! Highly recommended!

This was my second visit here; I bought my son for his first sushi experience. Although it's located in a shopping center, the decor is nice, Japanese themed of course.  For both my visits here I ordered off of the sushi menu; various rolls and negiri, and on each occasion the fish was very good. The service has always been prompt and friendly as well.   They regularly post sake-bomber specials, and although I haven't partaken in such (at this establishment at least) it appears they gladly cater to the boozy crowd. So if you're looking for some Kanpai camaraderie this is likely your place post dinner hours. If you're looking to bring some young ones (no, not Mike, Rick, Vyvyan or Neil - I mean your children) the lunch hour would likely be best.

Great experience, got seated right away.. sat at the sushi bar watched how they made my sushi. Delicious. Go for crazy boy roll and the calamari crunch roll great rolls. My boyfriend and I will for-sure be returning for more !
Sushi is fresh and their Philadelphia Roll was bomb!
Been going here for a while. It's always one of my favorite go to sushi places. Always fresh and clean with amazing food! Love them!!

Fresh sushi at great prices.  Korean owned...and the only reason I mention this is not to take away from the quality, but to point out that it tends to be at Korean places that you get the biggest bang for your buck. (Think about it...AYCE Korean BBQ, free ban-chan that comes out with every meal at Korean restaurants, etc). At Yen, you get Japanese quality sushi at affordable prices, with no compromise in taste or experience. That's the perfect combo for a sushi joint in my book.   Got the Small Sashimi Platter...25 pieces for $27!  They were good size sashimi slices too, and it included 5 pieces of each of the following: tuna, albacore, salmon, yellowtail, and octopus. Especially with sashimi, you can tell if the quality is good right away with fish like salmon and yellowtail bc they can be easily fishy; however, even with no sauces or rice to hide behind, all the sashimi was super fresh here.  Also ordered the Baked Lobster Roll (bc clearly my eyes were bigger than my stomach). It was tasty, with lots of lobster pieces on top...slightly too sweet for me bc of the sauce that was used, but still yummy.   Would definitely come back if I ever find myself in AZ again.

Let me start this review by saying I DON'T LIKE SUSHI.  My wife does and we have been to a few different sushi places over the years.  Every time I try a few pieces of what she gets and it has VERY rarely been even good.    Yesterday, however, we went to Yen Sushi & Sake Bar.  This place is fan-freaking-tastic.  We went during Happy hour and the prices were great.  I got a hot sake and a large beer.  We ordered a few rolls; a tempurad california roll, tempurad spicey tuna roll and a shrimp roll.  They were all perfect.  They are exactly what sushi should taste like.  The spicey tuna roll was simply perfect.  It had a sweet eel sauce on it that complemented the roll perfectly.    I would highly recommend if you go anywhere else for sushi you at least give this place a shot, you will not regret it.

Biggest Dragon roll I've ever seen. I LOVE their soft crab shell roll though. We came for happy hour but literally every roll but one was deep fried.  Service was friendly but she never really asked if we needed anything else after dropping off our food. (For instance I like sriracha) never got the chance to ask for some because she was already headed the other direction. I'm a server and I'm huge on pre bussing.  Our dirty plates were left on our table the entire time. It's not a bad place but we probably won't be returning back.

Their happy hour is amazing. Their staff is pretty friendly and helpful. The last time I was in we had a huge group and they did a pretty good job of taking care of us. It's no easy feat when we didn't stop talking almost the entire time.

Very good.  This place is really good.  Why?  The owners are the sushi chefs.  They buy high quality ingredients.  How do I know?  I worked for the company that supplies them a few things they cook up and they do not mind paying for quality.  The owner is notorious for his belief that good ingredients are expensive for a reason.    A lot of sushi places buy precut and plastic packaged salmon, tuna, and other fish.  The owner/sushi chef buys whole fresh fish and filets them himself.  The beef they use here is very good also.  Certified Angus Beef, in fact.  They don't even advertise that fact.  They let the quality speak for themselves.  Everything is good but my favorite thing to have here is the cold soba/buckwheat noodles.  If you haven't had them before, make sure you try it here.  They will blow you away.  I think one time I've had two orders of it.  I just make sure to order it whenever I go.    When the owner has a passion for the food he serves, it's gotta be good.  I live an hour away from this place and I make it one of my top choices to go for good sushi and japanese cuisine.    Give it a try, you won't be disappointed.
I love the food. My favorite is the crazy boy. I only give a 4 star because it takes forever for the food to come out. Other than that. one of my favs.

I am crazy impressed by the quality and freshness here. We enjoyed everything we ordered and had a large variety of sushi. The chopped wasabi is amazing with any sashimi particularly the yellowtail. Friendly service. The sushi chefs were excellent. Probably the best sushi restaurant I've been to Arizona and I've been to many.

Loyal Yen customer since 2011 back when it was a tiny 5x5 room haha. I met my husband here! Best sushi and food. I wish it wasn't so far out there but it's worth the drive! The service is hit or miss...  Some servers are rude and make you feel like you're wasting their time. Once we showed up at 7:30pm to drink while we waited for happy hour and the lady said there are other customers actually ordering food that she would rather wait on. She made sure not to come back until 8. Never asked if we needed anything. The food keeps bringing us back though.
